duas.en_reference: "Allah has promised that anyone who says this three times every morning orevening will be pleased on the Day of Resurrection."Ahmad 4/ 337,An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 4, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 68), At-Tirmidhi5/465. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #14

duas.ar_dua: يا حَـيُّ يا قَيّـومُ بِـرَحْمَـتِكِ أَسْتَـغـيث ،  أَصْلِـحْ لي شَـأْنـي كُلَّـه ،  وَلا تَكِلـني إِلى نَفْـسي طَـرْفَةَ عَـين
duas.transliteration: Yā Ḥayyu yā Qayyūmu biraḥmatika astaghīthaṣlih lī sha'nī kullah  wa lā takilnī ilā nafsī ṭarfata `ayn.
duas.en_translation: O Ever-Living One, O Eternal One, by Your mercy I call on You to set right all my affairs.Do not place me in charge of my soul even for the blinking of an eye (i.e. a moment).
duas.en_reference: Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), Al-Hakim 1/545, see Albani,Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib, 1/273.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #15

duas.ar_dua: أَصْبَـحْـنا وَأَصْبَـحْ المُـلكُ للهِ رَبِّ العـالَمـين ، اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أسْـأَلُـكَ خَـيْرَ هـذا الـيَوْم ،  فَـتْحَهُ ، وَنَصْـرَهُ ، وَنـورَهُ وَبَـرَكَتَـهُ ، وَهُـداهُ ،  وَأَعـوذُ بِـكَ مِـنْ شَـرِّ ما فـيهِ وَشَـرِّ ما بَعْـدَهوإذا أمسى قال:أَمْسَيْـنا وَأَمْسـى المُـلكُ للهِ رَبِّ العـالَمـين ،  اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أسْـأَلُـكَ خَـيْرَ هـذهِ اللَّـيْلَة ،  فَتْحَهـا ، وَنَصْـرَهـا ، وَنـورَهـا وَبَـرَكَتَـهـا ، وَهُـداهـا ،  وَأَعـوذُ بِـكَ مِـنْ شَـرِّ ما فـيهـاِ وَشَـرِّ ما بَعْـدَهـا
duas.transliteration: Aṣbaḥnā wa aṣbaḥal-mulku lillāhi Rabbi ‘l-a`lāmīn,Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayra hādha ‘l-yawm:
duas.en_translation: We have entered a new day and with it all the dominion which belongs to Allah, Lord of all that exists.O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of this day,2its victory, its help, its light,its blessings, and its guidance.  I seek refuge in You from the evil that is in it,  and from the evil that follows it.
duas.en_reference: 1 For evening recitation, say here: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahāthihil-laylah: "My Lord, I ask You for the good things of this night."2 Abu Dawud 4/322. Its transmission chain is good (Hasan). See also IbnAl-Qayyim, Zadul- Ma'ad 2/273.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #16

duas.ar_dua: أَصْـبَحْنا[أَمْسَـينا] علـى فِطْـرَةِ الإسْلام وَعَلـى كَلِـمَةِ الإخْـلاص وَعلـى دينِ نَبِـيِّنا مُحَـمَّدٍ وَعَلـى مِلَّـةِ أبينـا إِبْـراهيـمَ حَنيـفاً مُسْلِـماً وَمـا كـانَ مِنَ المُشـرِكيـن
duas.transliteration: Aṣbahnā `alā fiṭrati ‘l-Islām,wa `alā kalimati ‘l-ikhlās,wa `alā dīni nabiyyinā Muḥammadin (ṣallallāhu `alayhi wa sallam),wa `alā millati abīnā Ibrāhīm,ḥanīfan Muslimanwa mā kāna mina ‘l-mushrikīn.
duas.en_translation: We have entered a new day 1 upon the natural religion of Islam,the word of sincere devotion,the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him),and the faith of our father Ibrahim.He was upright (in worshipping Allah), and a Muslim.He was not of those who worship others besides Allah. 2
duas.en_reference: 1 When you say this in the evening, you should say: 'Amsaynā `alā fiṭratil-Islām...: "We end this day..."2 Ahmad 3/406-7, 5/123, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul- Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 34),At-Tirmidhi 4/209.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #17

duas.ar_dua: سُبْحـانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْـدِهِ . (مائة مرة)
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdih.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him.(Recite one hundred times in Arabic).
duas.en_reference: "Whoever recites this one hundred times in the morning and in the eveningwill not be surpassed on the Day of Resurrection by anyone having donebetter than this except for someone who had recited it more. "Al-Bukhari4/2071.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #18

duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ لا شَـريكَ لهُ،لهُ المُـلْكُ ولهُ الحَمْـد،وهُوَ على كُلّ شَيءٍ قَدير .  (عشر مرات أَوْ مرَّةً واحدةً عندَ الكَسَلِ)
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lah,lahu ‘l-mulku walahu ‘l-ḥamd,wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner.His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.(Recite ten times 1 in Arabic or one time to ward off laziness.) 2
duas.en_reference: 1Allah will write ten Hasanaat (rewards) for whoever recites this ten timesin the morning, and forgive him ten misdeeds and give him the reward offreeing ten slaves and protect him from Satan. Whoever recites this tentimes in the evening will get this same reward. An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawmwal-Laylah (no. 24). Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Albani1/272. Abu Hurayrah «fe narrated that the Prophet j§ said: "Allah willwrite one hundred Hasanat for whoever says There is no God but Allah alone,He has no partner. To Allah is possession of everything, and to Him allpraise is. He is Capable of all things' ten times in the morning, andforgive him one hundred misdeeds. He will have the reward of freeing aslave and will be protected from Satan throughout the day unto dusk.Whoever says it in the evening will have the same reward."Ahmad 8/704,16/293. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 44.  2 Whoever recites this in the morning, will have the reward of freeing aslave from the Children of Isma'il. Ten Hasanaat (rewards) will be writtenfor him, and he will be forgiven ten misdeeds, raised up ten degrees, andbe protected from Satan until evening. Whoever says it in the evening willhave the same reward until morning. Abu Dawud 4/319, 3/957, Ahmad 4/ 60,Ibn Majah 2/331, Ibn Al-Qayyim Zadul-Ma'ad 2/388. Its chain of transmissionis sound (Sahih). Al-Albani 1/270.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #19

duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ لا شَـريكَ لهُ،لهُ المُـلْكُ ولهُ الحَمْـد،وهُوَ على كُلّ شَيءٍ قَدير .(مائة مرة إذا أصبح)
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāhu waḥdahu lā sharīka lah,lahu ‘l-mulku walahu ‘l-ḥamd,wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner.His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things.(Recite 100 times in Arabic upon rising in the morning).
duas.en_reference: Whoever recites this one hundred times a day will have the reward offreeing ten slaves. One hundred Hasanaat (rewards) will be written for himand one hundred misdeeds will be washed away. He will be shielded fromSatan until the evening. No one will be able to present anything betterthan this except for someone who has recited more than this. Al-Bukhari4/95, Muslim 4/2071.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #20

duas.ar_dua: سُبْحـانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْـدِهِعَدَدَ خَلْـقِه ،وَرِضـا نَفْسِـه ،وَزِنَـةَ عَـرْشِـه ،وَمِـدادَ كَلِمـاتِـه .(ثلاث مرات إذا أصبح)
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāhi wa biḥamdih:
duas.en_translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him,by the multitude of His creation,by His Pleasure,by the weight of His Throne,and by the extent of His Words.(Recite three times in Arabic upon rising in the morning.)
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2090.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #21

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْماً نَافِعاً،وَرِزْقاً طَيِّباً،وَعَمَلاً مُتَقَبَّلاً(إذا أصبحَ)
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka `ilman nāfi`a,wa rizqan ṭayyiba,wa `amalan mutaqabbala.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit,a good provision,and deeds that will be accepted.(Recite in Arabic upon rising in the morning.)
duas.en_reference: Ibn As-Sunni, no. 54, Ibn Majah no. 925. Its chain of transmission is good(Hasan), Ibn Al-Qayyim 2/375.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #22

duas.ar_dua: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ(مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ فِي الْيَوْمِ)
duas.transliteration: Astaghfirullāha wa atūbu ilayh.
duas.en_translation: I seek the forgiveness of Allah and repent to Him. (Recite one hundred times in Arabic during the day.)
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101, Muslim 4/2075.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #23

duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِكَلِمـاتِ اللّهِ التّـامّـاتِ مِنْ شَـرِّ ما خَلَـق  (ثلاث مرات إِذا أمسى)
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti-llāhit-tāmmāti min sharri mā khalaq.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.(Recite three times in Arabic in the evening.)
duas.en_reference: Whoever recites this three times in the evening will be protected frominsect stings, Ahmad 2/ 290, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah no. 590,At-Tirmidhi 3/187, Ibn As-Sunni no. 68. According to Al-Albani, Ibn Majah's(2/266) chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), and following Ibn Baz 45,At-Tirmidhi's report is good (Hasan).
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said in the morning and evening #24

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَ سَلِّمْ عَلَى نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ  (عشر مرات)
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ṣalli wa sallim `alā nabiyyinā Muḥammad.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, we ask for your peace and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad.(Recite ten times in Arabic.)
duas.en_reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Who recites blessings upon me ten times in themorning and ten times in the evening will obtain my intercession on the Dayof Resurrection."At-Tabarani reported this Hadith together with two chainsof transmission. One of them is reliable (Jayyid). See Haythami'sMajma'uz-Zawa'id 10/120, and Al-Albani's Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib 1/273.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #1

duas.ar_dua: يَجْمَعُ كَفَّيْهِ ثُمَّ يَنْفُثُ فِيهِمَا فَيَقْرَأُ فِيهِمَا: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ  {قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ *  اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ*  لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ*  وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُواً أَحَدٌ}.  بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ  {قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ*  مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ*  وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ*  وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ*  وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ}.  بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ  {قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ*  مَلِكِ النَّاسِ*  إِلَهِ النَّاسِ*  مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ*  الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ*  مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ}  ثُمَّ يَمْسَحُ بِهِمَا مَا اسْتَطَاعَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ يَبْدَأُ بِهِمَا عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَوَجْهِهِ وَمَا أَقبَلَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ (يفعلُ ذلك ثلاثَ مرَّاتٍ)
duas.transliteration: Bismillāhir-Raḥmānir-Raḥīm.  Qul huwallāhu aḥad.  Allāhuṣ-ṣamad.  Lam yalid wa lam yūlad.  Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan aḥad.  Reference: Al-Ikhlas 112:1-4. Bismillāhir-Raḥmānir-Raḥīm.  Qul a`ūdhu birabbil-falaq.  Min sharri mā khalaq.  Wa min sharri ghāsiqin idhā waqab.  Wa min sharrin-naffāthāti fil-`uqad.  Wa min sharri ḥāsidin idhā ḥasad.  Reference: Al-Falaq 113:1-5. Bismillāhir-Raḥmānir-Raḥīm.  Qul a`ūdhu birabbin-nās.  Malikin-nās.  'Ilāhin-nās.  Min sharri ‘l-waswāsil-khannās.  Alladhī yuwaswisu fī ṣudūrin-nās.  Minal-jinnati wannās.  Reference: An-Nas 114:1-6
duas.en_translation: Hold the palms together, blow (with a little spittle) into them, and recite:  "With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.  Say: He is Allah (the) One.  The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need,  He begets not nor was He begotten,  and there is none equal to Him. With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.  Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak,  from the evil of what He has created,  and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness,  and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots,  and from the evil of the envier when he envies. With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.  Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind,  the King of mankind,  the God of mankind,  from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws,  who whispers in the breasts of mankind,  of jinns and men."(Then pass your hands over as much of your body as you can reach, beginning with the head and the face, then the entire front of your body. Do this three times.)
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 9/62, and Muslim 4/ 1723.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #2

duas.ar_dua: ((اللَّهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ  لاَ تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلاَ نَوْمٌ  لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الأَرْضِ  مَن ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِهِ  يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ  وَلاَ يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلاَّ بِمَا شَاء  وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضَ  وَلاَ يَؤُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا  وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ))
duas.transliteration: Allāhu lā ilāha illā huwa ‘l-Ḥayyul-Qayyūm,  lā ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa lā nawm,  lahu mā fis-samāwāti wa māfil-ardh,  man dhal-ladhī yashfa`u `indahu illā bi'idhnih,  ya`lamu mā bayna aydīhim wa mā khalfahum,  wa lā yuḥītūna bishay'im-min `ilmihi illā bimā shā',  wasi`a kursiyyuhus-samāwāti wal-ardh,  wa lā ya'ūduhu hifẓuhumā,  wa huwal-`Aliyyu‘l-`Aẓīm.
duas.en_translation: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists.  Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him.  To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.  Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission?  He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter.  And they will never encompass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills.  His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth,  and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them.  And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
duas.en_reference: Al-Baqarah 2:255. Whoever reads this when he lies down to sleep will have aguardian from Allah remain with him and Satan will not be able to come nearhim until he rises in the morning. See Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani,Fathul-Bari 4/487.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #3

duas.ar_dua: ((ءامَنَ الرَّسُولُ بِمَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مِن رَّبِّهِ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَكُلٌّ ءامَنَ بِاللهِ وَمَلآئِكَتِهِ وَكُتُبِهِ وَرُسُلِهِ  لاَ نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّن رُّسُلِهِ  وَقَالُواْ سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا  غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ {285}  لاَ يُكَلِّفُ اللهُ نَفْسًا إِلاَّ وُسْعَهَا  لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ  رَبَّنَا لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنَا إِن نَّسِينَا أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا  رَبَّنَا وَلاَ تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَا إِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُ عَلَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا  رَبَّنَا وَلاَ تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لاَ طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِ  وَاعْفُ عَنَّا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَآ  أَنتَ مَوْلاَنَا فَانصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ {286}))
duas.transliteration: Āmanar-Rasūlu bimā unzila ilaihi mir-Rabbihi wa ‘l-mu'minūn,kullun āmana billāhi wa malā'ikatihi wa kutubihi wa rusulih,lā nufarriqu bayna aḥadim-mir-rusulih,wa qālū sami`nā wa aṭa`nā,  ghufrānaka Rabbanā wa ilayka ‘l-maṣīr.Lā yukallifu ‘llāhu nafsan illā wus`ahā,lahā mā kasabat wa `alayhā mak-tasabat,Rabbanā lā tu'ākhidhnā in nasīnā aw akhta'nā,Rabbanā wa lā taḥmil `alaynā iṣran kamā ḥamaltahu `alal-ladhīna min qablinā,Rabbanā wa lā tuḥammilnā mā lā ṭāqata lanā bih,wa`fu `annā, waghfir lanā, warḥamnā,Anta mawlānā fanṣurnā `ala ‘l-qawmi ‘l-kāfirīn.
duas.en_translation: The Messenger believes in what has been sent down to him from his Lord, and so do the believers.Each one believes in Allah, His Angels, His Books, and His Messengers.They say:
duas.en_reference: Al-Baqarah 2:285-6. These two Verses will be sufficient for anyone whorecites them at night before sleeping. Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani,Fathul-Bari.9/94, Muslim 1/554.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #4

duas.ar_dua: بِاسْمِكَ رَبِّي وَضَعْتُ جَنْبِي،  وَبِكَ أَرْفَعُهُ،  فَإِن أَمْسَكْتَ نَفْسِي فارْحَمْهَا،  وَإِنْ أَرْسَلْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا  بِمَا تَحْفَظُ بِهِ عِبَادَكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
duas.transliteration: Bismika Rabbī waḍa`tu janbī,wa bika arfa`uh,fa in amsakta nafsī farḥamhā,wa in arsaltahā faḥfaẓhābimā taḥfaẓu bihi `ibādakaṣ-ṣāliḥīn.
duas.en_translation: With Your Name1 my Lord, I lay myself down;  and with Your Name I rise.And if You take my soul, have mercy on it,  and if You send it back thenprotect it as You protect Your righteous slaves.2
duas.en_reference: 1 "If any of you rises from his bed and later returns to it, let him dustoff his bed with his waist garment three times and mention the Name ofAllah, for he does not know what may have entered the bed after him, andwhen he lies down he should say. . . ".  2 Al-Bukhari 1 1/ 126 and Muslim 4/2084.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #5

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِي  وَأَنْتَ تَوَفَّاهَا،  لَكَ مَمَاتُهَا وَمَحْياهَا،  إِنْ أَحْيَيْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا،  وَإِنْ أَمَتَّهَا فَاغْفِرْ لَهَا.  اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ العَافِيَةَ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innaka khalaqta nafsī  wa anta tawaffāhā,laka mamātuhā wa maḥyāhā,in aḥyaytahā faḥfaẓhā,wa in amattahā faghfir lahā.  Allāhumma innī as'aluka ‘l-`āfiyah.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, You have created my soul  and You take it back.Unto You is its death and its life.If You give it life then protect it,and if You cause it to die then forgive it.  O Allah, I ask You for strength.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2083 and Ahmad 2/79.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #6

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ قِنـي عَذابَـكَ يَـوْمَ تَبْـعَثُ عِبـادَك .
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma qinī `adhābaka yawma tab`athu `ibādak.
duas.en_translation: O Allah,1 save me from Your punishment on the Day that You resurrect Your slaves.2
duas.en_reference: 1 "When the Prophet (ﷺ) wanted to lie down to sleep, he used to place hisright hand under his cheek and say..."2 Abu Dawud 4/311. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/143.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #7

duas.ar_dua: بِاسْـمِكَ اللّهُـمَّ أَمـوتُ وَأَحْـيا
duas.transliteration: Bismika Allāhumma amūtu wa aḥyā.
duas.en_translation: In Your Name, O Allah, I die and I live.
duas.en_reference: Here, dying and living are metaphors for sleep and wakefulness. Thisexplains why the normal order of these words has been reversed in thisHadith. In other contexts the living is mentioned before dying. See Qur'anAl-Baqarah 2:258, Aal-'Imrdn 3:156, Al-A'raf 7:158 among many otherexamples, (trans.). See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/2083.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #8

duas.ar_dua: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ (ثلاثاً وثلاثين)وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ (ثلاثاً وثلاثين)وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ (أربعاً وثلاثينَ)
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāh,Wa ‘l-ḥamdu lillāh,Wallāhu Akbar.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to Allah (thirty-three times in Arabic),Praise is to Allah (thirty-three times),  Allah is the Most Great (thirty-four times)
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 7/71, Muslim 4/2091.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #9

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ رَبَّ السّمـواتِ السَّبْـعِ وَرَبَّ العَـرْشِ العَظـيمرَبَّنـا وَرَبَّ كُـلِّ شَـيء  فالِـقَ الحَـبِّ وَالنَّـوى  وَمُـنَزِّلَ التَّـوْراةِ وَالإنْجـيل والفُـرْقان  أَعـوذُ بِـكَ مِن شَـرِّ كُـلِّ شَـيءٍ أَنْـتَ آخِـذٌ بِنـاصِـيَتِه  اللّهُـمَّ أَنْـتَ الأوَّلُ فَلَـيسَ قَبْـلَكَ شَيء  وَأَنْـتَ الآخِـرُ فَلَـيسَ بَعْـدَكَ شَيء  وَأَنْـتَ الظّـاهِـرُ فَلَـيْسَ فَـوْقَـكَ شَيء  وَأَنْـتَ الْبـاطِـنُ فَلَـيْسَ دونَـكَ شَيء  اقـْضِ عَنّـا الـدَّيْـنَ  وَأَغْـنِنـا مِنَ الفَـقْر
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma Rabbas-samāwātis-sab`iwa Rabba ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-`Aẓīm,Rabbanā wa Rabba kulli shay',fāliqa ‘l-ḥabbi wan-nawā,wa munzilat-Tawrāti wal-'Injīli, wal-Furqān,a`ūdhu bika min sharri kulli shay'inanta ākhidhun bināṣiyatih.Allāhumma anta ‘l-awwalu falaysa qablaka shay',wa antal-ākhiru falaysa ba`daka shay',wa antaẓ-ẓāhiru falaysa fawqaka shay',wa antal-bāṭinu falaysa dūnaka shay',iqḍi `annad-dayn,wa aghninā mina ‘l-faqr.
duas.en_translation: O Allah! Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Magnificent Throne.Our Lord and the Lord of everything. Splitter of the grain and the date-stone,  Revealer of the Torah and the Injeel1 and the Furqan (the Qur'an),  I seek refuge in You from the evil of everything that You shall seize by the forelock.2O Allah You are the First and nothing has come before you,and You are the Last, and nothing may come after You.You are the Most High, nothing is above You  and You are the Most Near, and nothing is nearer than You.  Remove our debts from us  and enrich us against poverty. 3
duas.en_reference: 1 The Scripture that was revealed to 'Isa (Jesus).  2 See Qur'an Al-'Alaq 96:15, where seizure by the forelock preceeds beingcast into Hell. (Translator)  3 Muslim 4/2084.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #10

duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا،  وَكَفَانَا، وَآوَانَا،  فَكَمْ مِمَّنْ لاَ كَافِيَ لَهُ وَلاَ مُؤْوِيَ
duas.transliteration: Alḥamdu lillāhil-lathī 'aṭ`amanā wa saqānā,wa kafānā, wa 'āwānā,  fakam mimman lā kāfiya lahu wa lā mu'wī.
duas.en_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has provided us with food and with drink, sufficed us and gave us an abode,  for how many are there with no provision and no home.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2085.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #11

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ عالِـمَ الغَـيْبِ وَالشّـهادَةِ  فاطِـرَ السّماواتِ وَالأرْضِ  رَبَّ كـلِّ شَـيءٍ وَمَليـكَه  أَشْهَـدُ أَنْ لا إِلـهَ إِلاّ أَنْت  أَعـوذُ بِكَ مِن شَـرِّ نَفْسـي  وَمِن شَـرِّ الشَّيْـطانِ وَشِـرْكِه  وَأَنْ أَقْتَـرِفَ عَلـى نَفْسـي سوءاً  أَوْ أَجُـرَّهُ إِلـى مُسْـلِم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma `ālima ‘l-ghaybi wash-shahādah,fātiras-samāwāti wa ‘l-ardh,  Rabba kulli shay'in wa malīkah,ash-hadu an lā ilāha illā ant,  a`ūdhu bika min sharri nafsī,wa min sharrish-shayṭāni wa shirkih,wa an aqtarifa `alā nafsī sū'an,aw ajurrahu ilā Muslim.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the evident,Maker of the heavens and the earth,Lord of everything and its Master,I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You.I seek refuge in You from the evil of mysoul,  and from the evil of Satan and his helpers.  (I seek refuge in You) from bringing evil upon my soul  and from harming any Muslim.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/317. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/142.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #12

duas.ar_dua: يقرأ ((ألم * تنزيل)) السجدة،  و((تبارك الذي بيده الملك))
duas.en_translation: Recite Surah 32 (As-Sajdah) and Surah 67 (Al-Mulk) in Arabic.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami ' As-Saghir 4/255
duas.subtitle: Remembrance before sleeping #13

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ أَسْـلَمْتُ نَفْـسي إِلَـيْكَ،  وَفَوَّضْـتُ أَمْـري إِلَـيْكَ،وَوَجَّـهْتُ وَجْـهي إِلَـيْكَ،  وَأَلْـجَـاْتُ ظَهـري إِلَـيْكَ،  رَغْبَـةً وَرَهْـبَةً إِلَـيْكَ،  لا مَلْجَـأَ وَلا مَنْـجـا مِنْـكَ إِلاّ إِلَـيْكَ،  آمَنْـتُ بِكِتـابِكَ الّـذي أَنْزَلْـتَ  وَبِنَبِـيِّـكَ الّـذي أَرْسَلْـت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma aslamtu nafsī ilayk,wa fawwaḍtu amrī ilayk,wa wajjahtu wajhī ilayk,wa alja'tu ẓahrī ilayk,raghbatan wa rahbatan ilayk,lā malja'a wa la manjā minka illā ilayk,āmantu bikitābika ‘l-ladhī anzalt,wa bi-nabiyyika ‘l-ladhī arsalt.
duas.en_translation: O Allah,1 I submit myself to You,entrust my affairs to You,turn my face to You,and lay myself down depending upon You,  hoping in You and fearing You.There is no refuge, and no escape, except to You.  I believe in Your Book (the Qur'an) that You revealed,  and the Prophet whom You sent.
duas.en_reference: 1 "Before you go to bed perform ablutions as you would for prayer, then liedown on your right side and say. . . "The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever says this and dies in his sleep, has diedin a state of the natural monotheism (Fitrah)."Al-Bukhari, cf.Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/2081.
duas.subtitle: Supplication when turning over during the night

duas.ar_dua: لا إِلـهَ إِلاّ اللهُ  الـواحِدُ القَهّـار  رَبُّ السَّـمواتِ وَالأرْضِ وَما بَيْـنَهـما  العَزيـزُ الغَـفّار
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh  al-Wāḥidul-Qahhār,Rabbus-samāwāti wa ‘l-arḍi wa mā baynahumaal-`Azīzul-Ghaffār.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah,the One, the Victorious,Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them,the All-Mighty, the All-Forgiving.
duas.en_reference: This is to be said if you turn over in bed during the night. Al-Hakimgraded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/540. Also see An-Nasa'i,'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Ibn As-Sunni. See also Al-Albani,Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/ 213.
duas.subtitle: Upon experiencing unrest, fear, apprehensiveness and the like during sleep

duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِكَلِمـاتِ اللّهِ التّـامّـاتِ  مِن غَضَـبِهِ وَعِـقابِهِ وَشَـرِّ عِبـادِهِ  وَمِنْ هَمَـزاتِ الشَّـياطينِ وَأَنْ يَحْضـرون
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmātimin ghaḍabihi wa `iqābihi wa sharri `ibādih,  wa min hamazātish-shayāṭīni wa an yaḥḍurūn.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah  from His anger and His punishment,  from the evil of His slaves,  and from the taunts of devils and from their presence.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/12. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmidhi 3/171
duas.subtitle: Upon seeing a bad dream #1

duas.ar_dua: يَنْفُثُ عَنْ يَسَارِهِ (ثلاثاً).  يَسْتَعِيذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ مَا رَأَى (ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ).  لاَ يُحَدِّثْ بِهَا أَحَداً.  يَــتَحَوَّلُ عَنْ جَنْبِهِ الَّذِي كَانَ عَلَيْهِ.
duas.en_translation: Spit to your left (three times).1 Seek refuge in Allah from the Devil and from the evil of what you have seen(three times).2 Do not speak about it to anyone.3 Turn over on your other side.4
duas.subtitle: Upon seeing a bad dream #2

duas.ar_dua: يقوم يصلي إن أراد ذلك.ويَقُومُ يُصَلِّي إِنْ أَرَادَ ذَلِكَ.
duas.en_translation: Get up and pray if you desire to do so.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/1773.
duas.subtitle: Du'â Qunût Al-Witr  #1

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ اهْـدِنـي فـيمَنْ هَـدَيْـت وَعـافِنـي فـيمَنْ عافَـيْت وَتَوَلَّـني فـيمَنْ تَوَلَّـيْت وَبارِكْ لـي فـيما أَعْطَـيْت وَقِـني شَرَّ ما قَضَـيْت فَإِنَّـكَ تَقْـضي وَلا يُقْـضى عَلَـيْك إِنَّـهُ لا يَـذِلُّ مَنْ والَـيْت [ وَلا يَعِـزُّ مَن عـادَيْت ] تَبـارَكْـتَ رَبَّـنا وَتَعـالَـيْت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’hdinī fī man hadayt,wa `āfinī fī man `āfayt,wa tawallanī fī man tawallayt,wa bārik lī fī mā a`atayt,wa qinī sharra mā qaḍayt,fa innaka taqḍī wa lā yuqḍā `alayk,innahu lā yadhillu man wālayt,[wa lā ya`izzu man `ādayt] ,tabārakta Rabbanā wa ta`ālayt.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, guide me with those whom You have guided,and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength.  Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care.  Bless me in what You have given me.  Protect me from the evil You have ordained.  Surely, You command and are not commanded,  and none whom You have committed to Your care shall be humiliated  [and none whom You have taken as an enemy shall taste glory].  You are Blessed, Our Lord, and Exalted.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ahmad, Ad-Darimi, Al-Hakim,and Al-Bayhaqi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/144, Sahih IbnMajah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW. 2/ 172.
duas.subtitle: Du'â Qunût Al-Witr  #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أَعـوذُ بِرِضـاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِـك،  وَبِمُعـافاتِـكَ مِنْ عُقوبَـتِك،  وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْـك،  لا أُحْصـي ثَنـاءً عَلَـيْك،  أَنْـتَ كَمـا أَثْنَـيْتَ عَلـى نَفْسـِك
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu biriḍāka min sakhaṭik,wa bimu`āfātika min `uqūbatik,wa a`ūdhu bika mink,lā uḥṣī thanā'an `alayk,  Anta kamā athnayta `alā nafsik.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with Your Pleasure from Your anger.I seek refuge in Your forgiveness from Your punishment.I seek refuge in You from You.I cannot count Your praises,You are as You have praised Yourself.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmidhi, Ahmad. See Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/180, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil. 2/ 175.
duas.subtitle: Du'â Qunût Al-Witr  #3

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِيّـاكَ نعْـبُدْ،  وَلَـكَ نُصَلّـي وَنَسْـجُد،  وَإِلَـيْكَ نَسْـعى وَنَحْـفِد،  نَـرْجو رَحْمَـتَك،  وَنَخْشـى عَـذابَك،  إِنَّ عَـذابَكَ بالكـافرين ملْحَـق.  اللّهُـمَّ إِنّا نَسْتَعـينُكَ  وَنَسْتَـغْفِرُك،وَنُثْـنـي عَلَـيْك الخَـيْرَ،  وَلا نَكْـفُرُك،  وَنُـؤْمِنُ بِك،وَنَخْـضَعُ لَكَ  وَنَخْـلَعُ مَنْ يَكْـفرُك
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma iyyāka na`bud,wa laka nuṣallī wa nasjud,wa ilayka nas`ā wa naḥfid,narjū raḥmatak,wa nakhshā `adhābak,inna `adhābaka bilkāfirīna mulḥaq.Allāhumma innā nasta`īnuk,wa nastaghfiruk,wa nuthnī `alaykal-khayr,wa lā nakfuruk,wa nu'minu bik,wa nakhḍa`u lak,wa nakhla`u man yakfuruk.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, You alone do we worship,  and to You we pray and bow down prostrate.To You we hasten to worship and to serve.  Our hope is for Your mercy,  and we fear Your punishment.Surely, Your punishment of the disbelievers is at hand.O Allah, we seek Your help and Your forgiveness,and we praise You beneficently.We do not deny You and we believe in You.We surrender to Youand renounce whoever disbelieves in You.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bayhaqi graded its chain authentic in As-Sunan Al-Kubra. Al-Albani saidin 'Irwa'ul-GhaliL 2/170 that its chain is authentic as a statement of'Umar.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance immediately after the Taslîm of the Witr Ŝalâh

duas.ar_dua: "سبحان الملك القدوس"ثلاث مرات والثالثة يجهر بها ويمد بها صوته  "ربِّ الملائكةِ والرّوح"
duas.transliteration: Subḥāna ‘l-Maliki ‘l-Quddūs.  [Recite three times, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say...]  Rabbi ‘l-Malā'ikati war-rūh.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to the King, the Holy.  [Recite three times in Arabic, and raise and extend the voice on the third time and say...]  Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
duas.en_reference: An-Nasa'i 3/244, Ad-Daraqutni and others. The final addition is fromAd-Daraqutni's version 2/ 31 and its chain of narration is authentic. Seethe checking of Zadul-Ma'ad by Shu'aib Al-Arna'ut and 'Abdul-QadirAl-Arna'ut 1/337.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for anxiety and sorrow #1

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّي عَبْـدُكَ  ابْنُ عَبْـدِكَ  ابْنُ أَمَتِـكَ  نَاصِيَتِي بِيَـدِكَ  مَاضٍ فِيَّ حُكْمُكَ  عَدْلٌ فِيَّ قَضَاؤكَ  أَسْأَلُـكَ بِكُلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ  سَمَّـيْتَ بِهِ نَفْسَكَ  أِوْ أَنْزَلْتَـهُ فِي كِتَابِكَأَوْ عَلَّمْـتَهُ أَحَداً مِنْ خَلْقِـكَ  أَوِ اسْتَـأْثَرْتَ بِهِ فِي عِلْمِ الغَيْـبِ عِنْـدَكَ  أَنْ تَجْـعَلَ القُرْآنَ رَبِيـعَ قَلْبِـي  وَنورَ صَـدْرِي  وجَلَاءَ حُـزْنِي  وذَهَابَ هَمِّـي
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī `abduk,ibnu `abdik,ibnu amatik,nāsiyatī biyadik,māḍin fiyya ḥukmuk,  `adlun fiyya qaḍā'uk,as'aluka bikullis’min huwa lak,sammayta bihi nafsak,aw anzaltahu fī kitābik,aw `allamtahu aḥadan min khalqik,aw‘ista'tharta bihi fī `ilmil-ghaybi `indak,  an taj`ala ‘l-Qur'āna rabī`a qalbī,wa nūra ṣadrī,wa jalā'a ḥuznī,wa dhahāba hammī.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I am Your slave,  and the son of Your male slave,  and the son of your female slave.My forehead is in Your Hand (i.e. you have control over me).Your Judgment upon me is assured,  and Your Decree concerning me is just.I ask You by every Name that You have named Yourself with,revealed in Your Book,taught any one of Your creation,or kept unto Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen that is with You,to make the Qur'an the spring of my heart,  and the light of my chest,  the banisher of my sadness,  and the reliever of my distress.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 1/391, and Al-Albani graded it authentic.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for anxiety and sorrow #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَعْوذُ بِكَ مِنَ  الهَـمِّ وَ الْحُـزْنِ،  والعًجْـزِ والكَسَلِ  والبُخْـلِ والجُـبْنِ،  وضَلْـعِ الـدَّيْنِ  وغَلَبَـةِ الرِّجال
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma 'innī 'a`ūdhu bikamina ‘l-ḥammi wa ‘l-ḥuzn,wa ‘l-`ajzi wa ‘l-kasal,wa ‘l-bukhli wa ‘l-jubn,wa ḍala`id-dayn,wa ghalabatir-rijāl.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in you  from grief and sadness,  from weakness and from laziness,  from miserliness and from cowardice,  from being overcome by debt  and overpowered by men (i.e. others).
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/158. See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/173.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one in distress #1

duas.ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ  الْعَظـيمُ الْحَلِـيمْ،  لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُرَبُّ العَـرْشِ العَظِيـمِ،  لَا إِلَـهَ إِلَّا اللَّهْ  رَبُّ السَّمَـوّاتِ ورّبُّ الأَرْضِ  ورَبُّ العَرْشِ الكَـريم
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh  al-`Aẓīmul-Ḥalīm,lā ilāha illallāh  Rabbu ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-'Aẓīm,lā ilāha illallāh  Rabbus-samāwāti wa Rabbu ‘l-arḍwa Rabbu ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-Karīm.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah,the Mighty, the Forbearing.There is none worthy of worship but Allah,  Lord of the Magnificent Throne.There is none worthy of worship but Allah,  Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth,and Lord of the Noble Throne.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 8/154, Muslim 4/2092
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one in distress #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ رَحْمَتَـكَ أَرْجـوفَلا تَكِلـني إِلى نَفْـسي طَـرْفَةَ عَـيْن،وَأَصْلِـحْ لي شَأْنـي كُلَّـهلَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أنْـت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma raḥmataka arjūfalā takilnī ilā nafsī ṭarfata `ayn,wa aṣliḥ lī sha'nī kullah,lā ilāha illā ant.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I hope for Your mercy.Do not leave me to myself even for the blinking of an eye (i.e. a moment).Correct all of my affairs for me.There is none worthy of worship but You.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42. Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud3/959.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one in distress #3

duas.ar_dua: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أنْـت سُـبْحانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْـتُ مِنَ الظّـالِميـن
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illā anta subḥānakainnī kuntu minaẓ-ẓālimīn.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but You, glory is to You.Surely, I was among the wrongdoers.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/529. Al-Hakim declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreedwith him 1/ 505. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/168.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one in distress #4

duas.ar_dua: اللهُ اللهُ رَبِّي لا أُشْـرِكُ بِهِ شَيْـئاً
duas.transliteration: Allāh, Allāhu Rabbī lā ushriku bihi shay'a.
duas.en_translation: Allah, Allah is my Lord. I do not associate anything with Him.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/87. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mdjah 2/335.
duas.subtitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #1

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنا نَجْـعَلُكَ في نُحـورِهِـم،  وَنَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرورِهـمْ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innā naj`aluka fī nuḥūrihimwa na`ūdhu bika min shurūrihim.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, we ask You to restrain them by their necks,  and we seek refuge in You from their evil.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/89, and Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed2/142.
duas.subtitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ أَنْتَ عَضُـدي، وَأَنْتَ نَصـيري،  بِكَ أَجـولُ وَبِكَ أَصـولُ وَبِكَ أُقـاتِل
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma anta `aḍudī, wa anta naṣīrī,bika ajūlu, wa bika aṣūlu, wa bika uqātil.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, You are my strength and You are my support.For Your sake, I go forth and for Your sake, I advance and for Your sake, I fight.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 3/42, At-Tirmidhi 5/572. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi3/183.
duas.subtitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #3

duas.ar_dua: حَسْبُـنا اللهُ وَنِعْـمَ الوَكـيل
duas.transliteration: Ḥasbunallāhu wa ni`mal-wakīl.
duas.en_translation: Allah is sufficient for us and the best of those on whom to depend.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, 5/172.
duas.subtitle: For fear of the opression of rulers #1

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ ربَّ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ،  وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ،كُنْ لِي جَاراً مِنْ فُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنٍ،  وَأَحْزَابِهِ مِنْ خَلاَئِقِكَ،  أَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيَّ أَحَدٌ مِنْهُمْ أَوْ يَطْغَى،  عَزَّ جَارُكَ،  وَجَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ،  وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma Rabbas-samāwātis-sab`,wa Rabba ‘l-`Arshi ‘l-`Aẓīm,kun lī jāran min [here you mention the person's name],wa aḥzābihi min khalā'iqik,an yafruṭa `alayya aḥadun minhum aw yaṭghā,`azza jāruk,wa jalla thanā'uk,wa lā ilāha illā ant.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens,Lord of the Magnificent Throne,be for me a support against [such and such a person] and his helpers from among your creatures,lest any of them abuse me or do me wrong.  Mighty is Your patronage,  and glorious are Your praises.  There is none worthy of worship but You.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 707). Al-Albani graded it authentic inSahih Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 545).
duas.subtitle: For fear of the opression of rulers #2

duas.ar_dua: الله أكبر،  الله أعز من خلقه جميعاً ،  الله أعز مما أخاف وأحذر ،  أعوذ بالله الذي لا إله إلا هو ،  الممسك السموات السبعأن يقعن على الأرض إلا بإذنه ،  من شر عبدك فلان ،  وجنوده وأتباعه وأشياعه ،  من الجن والأنس ،  اللهم كن لي جاراً من شرهم ،  جل ثناؤك وعز جارك ،وتبارك اسمك ،ولا إله غيرك  (ثلاث مرات)
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar,Allāhu a`azzu min khalqihi jamī`a,Allāhu a`azzu mimmā akhāfu wa aḥdhar,a`ūdhu billāhi ‘l-ladhī lā ilāha illā hū,  almumsikis-samāwātis-sab`i an yaqa`na `ala ‘l-arḍi illā bi idhnih,  min sharri `abdika [name of the person],wa junūdihi wa atbā`ihi wa ashyā`ih,mina ‘l-jinni wa ‘l-ins,Allāhumma kun lī jāran min sharrihim,  jalla thanā'uk,  wa `azza jāruk,  wa tabāraka-smuk,wa lā ilāha ghayruk.
duas.en_translation: Allah is the Most Great,Mightier than all His creation.He is Mightier than what I fear and dread.I seek refuge in Allah, Who there is none worthy of worship but Him.He is the One Who holds the seven heavens from falling upon the earth except by His command.[I seek refuge in You Allah] from the evil of Your slave [name of the person],and his helpers, his followers, and his supporters from among the jinn and mankind.  O Allah, be my support against their evil.  Glorious are Your praises  and mighty is Your patronage.  Blessed is Your Name,  there is no true God but You.  (Recite three times in Arabic.)
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, 5/172.
duas.subtitle: Against enemies

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ مُنْزِلَ الْكِتَاب  سَرِيعَ الْحِسَاب  اهْزِم الأَحْزَاب  اللَّهُمَّ اهْزِمْهُمْ وَ زَلْزِلْهُم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma munzila ‘l-kitāb,sarī`a ‘l-ḥisāb,ihzimi ‘l-aḥzāb,Allāhumma-hzimhum wa zalzilhum.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Revealer of the Book,Swift to account,defeat the groups (of disbelievers).O Allah, defeat them and shake them.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 3/1362.
duas.subtitle: When afraid of a group people

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِيهِم بمَا شِئْت
duas.transliteration: Allāhummak-finīhim bimā shi't.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, suffice (i.e. protect) me against them however You wish.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2300.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one afflicted with doubt in his faith #1

duas.ar_dua: يَسْتَعِيذُ بِاللَّهِ.  يَنْتَهِي عَمَّا شك فِيهِ.
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāh
duas.en_translation: (Say:
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/336, Muslim 1/120.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one afflicted with doubt in his faith #2

duas.ar_dua: يقول"آمنت بالله ورسله"
duas.transliteration: Āmantu billāhi wa Rusulih.
duas.en_translation: (Say:
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one afflicted with doubt in his faith #3

duas.ar_dua: يقرأ قوله تعالى ((هُوَ الأوَّلُ، وَالآخِـرُ،  وَالظّـاهِـرُ، وَالْبـاطِـنُ،وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَلـيم))
duas.transliteration: Huwa ‘l-Awwalu wa ‘l-Ākhir,  waẓ-Ẓāhiru wal-Bāṭin,wa huwa bikulli shay'in `Alīm.
duas.en_translation: (Recite the Ayat) He is the First and the Last,the Most High and the Most Near.And He is the Knower of all things (in Arabic).
duas.en_reference: Al-Hadid 57:3, Abu Dawud 4/329. Al-Albani graded it good in SahihAbu Dawud,3/962.
duas.subtitle: Settling a debt #1

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ اكْفِـني بِحَلالِـكَ عَنْ حَـرامِـك،  وَأَغْنِـني بِفَضْـلِكَ عَمَّـنْ سِـواك
duas.transliteration: Allāhummak-finī biḥalālika `an ḥarāmik,wa 'aghninī bi faḍlika `amman siwāk.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden,and make me independent of all others besides You.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/560. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/180.
duas.subtitle: Settling a debt #2

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ،  وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ،  وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ،  وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika mina ‘l-ḥammi wa ‘l-ḥazan,wa ‘l-`ajzi wa ‘l-kasal,  wa ‘l-bukhli wa ‘l-jubn,wa ḍala`id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijāl.
duas.en_translation: O Allah! I seek refuge with You from worry and grief,  from incapacity and laziness,  from cowardice and miserliness,  from being heavily in debt and from being overpowered by (other) men.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/158.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one afflicted by whisperings in prayer or recitation

duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ،وَاتْفُلْ عَلَى يَسَارِكَ (ثلاثاً)
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāhi minash-shayṭānir-rajīm.
duas.en_translation: (Say:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/1729.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one whose affairs have become difficult

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ سَهْلَ إِلاَّ مَا جَعَلْتَهُ سَهْلاً،  وَأَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزْنَ إِذَا شِئْتَ سَهْلاً
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma lā saḥla illā ma ja`altahu saḥlawa anta taj`alu ‘l-ḥazna idhā shi'ta saḥla.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, there is no ease other than what You make easy.If You please You ease sorrow.
duas.en_reference: Ibn Hibban in his Sahih (no. 2427), and Ibn As- Sunni (no. 351). Al-Hafidh(Ibn Hajar) said that this Hadith is authentic. It was also declaredauthentic by 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut in his checking of An-Nawawi'sKitabul-Athkarp. 106.
duas.subtitle: Upon committing a sin

duas.ar_dua: مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ يُذنِبُ ذَنْباً فَيُحْسِنُ الطُّهُورَ، ثُمَّ يَقُومُ فَيُصَلِّي رَكْعَتَيْنِ، ثُمَّ يَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ إِلاَّ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ
duas.en_translation: There is not any slave of Allah who commits a sin, then he perfects his purification and stands to pray two Rak'ahs of prayer, then seeks Allah's forgiveness, except that Allah will forgive him.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/86, At-Tirmidhi 2/257. Al-Albani graded it authentic in SahihAbu Dawud 1/283.
duas.subtitle: Supplications for expelling the devil and his whisperings #1

duas.ar_dua: الاستعاذة بالله منه
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāhi minash-shayṭānir-rajīm.
duas.en_translation: Seeking refuge with Allah against him (i.e. by saying I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast).
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 1/206, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 1/77,and Surat Al-Mu'minun, 23:98-9.
duas.subtitle: Supplications for expelling the devil and his whisperings #2

duas.ar_dua: الْأَذَانُ
duas.en_translation: The call to prayer - 'Athan.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 1/291, Al-Bukhari 1/151.
duas.subtitle: Supplications for expelling the devil and his whisperings #3

duas.ar_dua: الْأَذْكَارُ وَقِرَاءَةُ الْقُرْآنِ
duas.en_translation: Saying words of Allah's remembrance (Thikr) and recitation of the Qur'an.
duas.en_reference: "Do not turn your homes into graveyards, surely the Devil flees from thehouse in which Surat Al-Baqarah is read,"Muslim 1/539. The Devil is alsodriven out by the invocations for morning and evening, those that are saidbefore sleeping and upon waking up, those for entering and leaving thehouse, including those for entering and leaving the mosque, and by manyother authentic invocations taught to us by the Prophet (ﷺ) such as thereading of 'Ayatul-Kursi, (Al-Baqarah 2:255), and the last two 'Ayat ofSurat Al-Baqarah before going to sleep. Whoever says: "There is none worthyof worship but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and Hisis the praise, and he is Able to do all things,"one hundred times, it willbe a protection for him from the Devil throughout the day.'
duas.subtitle: Supplication when stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair

duas.ar_dua: قَدَّرَ اللهُ وَما شـاءَ فَعَـل
duas.transliteration: Qaddarallāhu wa mā shā'a fa`al.
duas.en_translation: It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.
duas.en_reference: "The strong believer is better and more dear to Allah than the weakbeliever, and in each of them there is good. Be vigilant for what is toyour benefit and seek the help of Allah and do not falter. But when you arestriken by some setback, do not say: 'If only I had done such and such,'rather say: 'It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills.' Forverily the saying 'if (i.e. if only I had) begins the work of the Devil."Muslim 4/2052.
duas.subtitle: Congratulations on the occasion of a birth

duas.ar_dua: (بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ لَكَ،وَشَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ،وَبَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ،وَرُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ).وَيَرُدُّ عَلَيْهِ الْمُهَــــــنَّأُ فَيَقُولُ:  (بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ،وَجَزَاكَ اللَّهُ خَيْراً،وَرَزَقَكَ اللَّهُ مِثْلَهُ،وَأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ).
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu laka fi ‘l-mawhūbi lak,wa shakarta ‘l-wāhib,wa balagha ashuddah,wa ruziqta birrah. The reply of the person being congratulated is to say:
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you with His gift to you,and may you (the new parent) give thanks,  may the child reach the maturity of years,  and may you be granted its righteousness.  The reply of the person being congratulated is to say: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you,and may Allah reward you well  and bestow upon you its likeand reward you abundantly
duas.en_reference: An-Nawawi, Kitdbul-'Athkarp. 349, and Sahihul-'Athkar2/7l3 by SaleemAl-Hilali.
duas.subtitle: Placing children under Allah's protection

duas.ar_dua: كان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يعوذ الحسن والحسين  "أعيذكما بكلمات الله التامة ،  من كل شيطان وهامة ،ومن كل عينِ لامة "
duas.transliteration: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek Allah's protection for Al-Hasan and Al-Husain by saying:
duas.en_translation: I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allahfrom every devil and every beast,and from every envious blameworthy eye.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari4/119.
duas.subtitle: When visiting the sick #1

duas.ar_dua: لا بأْسَ طَهـورٌ إِنْ شـاءَ الله
duas.transliteration: Lā ba'sa ṭahūrun in shā Allāh.
duas.en_translation: Do not worry, it will be a purification (for you), Allah willing.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani Fathul-Bari 10/118.
duas.subtitle: When visiting the sick #2

duas.ar_dua: أَسْـأَلُ اللهَ العَـظيـم، رَبَّ العَـرْشِ العَـظيـم أَنْ يَشْفـيك .  (سبع مرات)
duas.transliteration: As'alullāha ‘l-`Aẓīma Rabba ‘l-`Arshil-`Aẓīmi an yashfiyak.
duas.en_translation: I ask Almighty Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, to make you well.(Recite seven times in Arabic)
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/210 andSahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/180.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of visiting the sick

duas.ar_dua: قَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (إِذَا عَادَ الرَّجُلُ أَخَاهُ الْمُسْلِمَ مَشَى فِي خِرَافَةِ الْجَنَّةِ حَتَّى يَجْلِسَ، فَإِذَا جَلَسَ غَمَرَتْهُ الرَّحْمَةُ، فَإِنْ كَانَ غُدْوَةً صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ، وَإِنْ كَانَ مَسَاءً صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ أَلْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ)
duas.en_translation: When a man goes to visit his sick Muslim brother, he walks along a path of Paradise until he sits, and when he sits he is cloaked in mercy. If he comes in the morning, seventy thousand angels pray for him until evening, and if he comes in the evening, seventy thousand angels pray for him until morning.
duas.en_reference: Hisnul Muslim 149
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life #1

duas.ar_dua: أللّهُـمَّ اغْفِـرْ لي وَارْحَمْـنيوَأَلْحِقْـني بِالرَّفـيقِ الأّعْلـى
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir lī warḥamnīwa alḥiqnī bir-rafīqi ‘l-'A`alā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive me and have mercy upon me,and join me with the highest companions (in Paradise).
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari7/10, Muslim 4/1893.
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life #2

duas.ar_dua: جعل النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم عند موته يدخل يديه في الماء فيمسح بهما وجههُ ويقول :  لا إله إلا الله إن للموت لسكرات
duas.transliteration: As he was dying, the Prophet (ﷺ) dipped his hands in water and wiped his face saying:
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah,surely death has agonies.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/144. The Hadith also mention himusing the Siivak (tooth stick).
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life #3

duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ  وَاللّهُ أَكْبَـر،  لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ وحْـدَهُ،  لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ  وحْـدَهُ لا شَريكَ لهُ،  لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ  لهُ المُلكُ ولهُ الحَمْد،  لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ  وَلا حَـوْلَ وَلا قُـوَّةَ إِلاّ بِالله
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh  wallāhu Akbar,lā ilāha illallāhu waḥdah,  lā ilāha illallāh  waḥdahu lā sharīka lah,lā ilāha illallāh  lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamd,lā ilāha illallāh  wa lā ḥawla wa lā quwwata illā billāh.
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah,Allah is the Most Great.None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone.None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone,Who has no partner.There is none worthy of worship but Allah,  His is the dominion and His is the praise.  There is none worthy of worship but Allah,  there is no power and no might but by Allah.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152 andSahih Ibn Majah 2/317.
duas.subtitle: Instruction for the one nearing death

duas.ar_dua: من كان آخر كلامه "لا إله إلا الله"دخل الجنة
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh
duas.en_translation: Whoever dies with the last words (whose meaning is):
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 3/190. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/432.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for one afflicted by a calamity

duas.ar_dua: إِنّا للهِ وَإِنَا إِلَـيْهِ راجِعـون ،  اللهُـمِّ اْجُـرْني في مُصـيبَتي،وَاخْلُـفْ لي خَيْـراً مِنْـها
duas.transliteration: Innā lillāhi wa innā ilayhi rāji`ūn,Allāhumma-jurni fī muṣībatīwa 'khluf lī khayran minhā.
duas.en_translation: We are from Allah and unto Him we return.O Allah take me out of my plightand bring to me after it something better.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/632.
duas.subtitle: When closing the eyes of the deceased

duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ اغْفِـرْ لِـفلان (باسـمه)  وَارْفَعْ دَرَجَتَـهُ في المَهْـدِييـن ،وَاخْـلُفْـهُ في عَقِـبِهِ في الغابِـرين،وَاغْفِـرْ لَنـا وَلَـهُ يا رَبَّ العـالَمـين،  وَافْسَـحْ لَهُ في قَبْـرِهِ وَنَـوِّرْ لَهُ فيه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir li (name of the person)warfa` darajatahu fi ‘l-mahdiyyīn,  wakhlufhu fī `aqibihi fi ‘l-ghābirīn,wagh’fir-lanā wa lahu yā Rabba ‘l-`ālamīn,wafsaḥ lahu fī qabrihi wa nawwir lahu fīh.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive [name of the person]  and elevate his station among those who are guided.Send him along the path of those who came before,and forgive us and him, O Lord of the worlds.  Enlarge for him his grave, and shed light upon him in it.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/634.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #1

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِحَيِّنَا، وَمَيِّتِنَا، وَشَاهِدِنَا، وَغَائِبِنَا، وَصَغِيْرِنَا، وَكَبِيْرِنَا، وَذَكَرِنَا، وَأُنْثَانَا، اللَّهُمَّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَأَحْيِهِ عَلَى الإِسْلامِ، وَمَنْ تَوَفَّيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَتَوَفَّهُ عَلَى الإِيْمَانِ، اللَّهُمَّ لَا تَحْرِمْنَا أَجْرَهُ، وَلَا تُضِلَّنَا بَعْدَهُ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir lahu warḥamh,wa `āfihi, wa`fu `anh,wa akrim nuzulah,wa wassi` mudkhalah,wagh’silhu bi ‘lmā'i wath-thalji walbarad,wa naqqihi mina ‘l-khaṭāyā  kamā naqqaytath-thawba ‘l-abyaḍa minad-danas,wa abdilhu dāran khayran min dārih,wa ahlan khayran min ahlih,wa zawjan khayran min zawjih,wa adkhilhu ‘l-jannah,wa a`idhhu min `adhābi ‘l-qabri [wa `adhābin-nār].
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him,and give him strength and pardon him.Be generous to him,and cause his entrance to be wide,and wash him with water and snow and hail.Cleanse him of his transgressionsas white cloth is cleansed of stains.Give him an abode better than his home,and a family better than his family,and a wife better than his wife.Take him into Paradise,and protect him from the punishment of the grave [and from the punishment of Hell-fire].
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/663.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #2

duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ اغْفِـرْ لِحَيِّـنا وَمَيِّتِـنا،وَشـاهِدِنا وَغائِبِـنا ،وَصَغيـرِنا وَكَبيـرِنا ،  وَذَكَـرِنا وَأُنْثـانا .  اللهُـمِّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْـتَهُ مِنّا  فَأَحْيِـهِ عَلى الإِسْلام ،  وَمَنْ تَوَفَّـيْتَهُ مِنّا فَتَوَفَّـهُ عَلى الإِيـمان ،  اللهُـمِّ لا تَحْـرِمْنـا أَجْـرَه ،  وَلا تُضِـلَّنا بَعْـدَه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir liḥayyinā, wa mayyitinā,wa shāhidinā, wa ghā'ibinā,  wa ṣaghīrinā wa kabīrinā,wa dhakarinā wa unthānā.Allāhumma man aḥyaytahu minnāfa aḥyihi `ala ‘l-Islām,wa man tawaffaytahu minnā  fatawaffahu `alal-īmān,Allāhumma lā taḥrimnā ajrah  wa lā tuḍillanā ba`dah.
duas.en_translation: O Allah forgive our living and our dead,those who are with us and those who are absent,our young and our old,our menfolk and our womenfolk.O Allah, whomever you give life from among usgive him life in Islam,and whomever you take away from ustake him away in Faith.O Allah, do not forbid us their rewardand do not send us astray after them.
duas.en_reference: Ibn Majah 1/480, Ahmad 2/368. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #3

duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ إِنَّ فُلانَ بْنَ فُلانٍ في ذِمَّـتِك ،وَحَبْـلِ جِـوارِك ،فَقِـهِ مِنْ فِتْـنَةِ الْقَـبْرِ وَعَذابِ النّـار ،وَأَنْتَ أَهْلُ الْوَفـاءِ وَالْـحَقِّ ،فَاغْفِـرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْـهُ ،إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَـفورُ الـرَّحيم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma inna [name the person] fī dhimmatik,wa ḥabli jiwārik,faqihi min fitnati ‘l-qabri wa `adhābin-nār,wa anta ahlu ‘l-wafā'i wa ‘l-ḥaqq.Faghfir lahu warḥamh  innaka anta ‘l-Ghafūrur-Raḥīm.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, surely [name the person] is under Your protection,  and in the rope of Your security,  so save him from the trial of the grave and from the punishment of the Fire.  You fulfill promises and grant rights,  so forgive him and have mercy on him.  Surely You are Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
duas.en_reference: Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud 3/211. See also Al Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #4

duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ عَبْـدُكَ وَابْنُ أَمَـتِك،  احْتـاجَ إِلى رَحْمَـتِك،  وَأَنْتَ غَنِـيٌّ عَنْ عَذابِـه،  إِنْ كانَ مُحْـسِناً فَزِدْ في حَسَـناتِه،  وَإِنْ كانَ مُسـيئاً فَتَـجاوَزْ عَنْـه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma `abduka wabnu 'amatikiḥtāja ilā raḥmatik,wa anta ghaniyyun `an `adhābih,in kāna muḥsinan fazid fī ḥasanātih,wa in kāna musī'an fatajāwaz `anh.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Your male slave and the child of Your female slave is in need of Your mercy,and You are not in need of his torment.If he was pious then increase his rewards  and if he was a transgressor then pardon him.
duas.en_reference: Al-Hakim 1/359 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him. Seealso Al-Albani, Ahkamul-Jana'iz, p. 125.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the deceased child at the funeral prayer #1

duas.ar_dua: "اللهم أعذه من عذاب القبر "وإن قال:"اللهم اجعله فرطاً وذخراً لوالديه ،  وشفيعاً مجاباً .  اللهم ثقل به موازينهاوأعظم به أجورهما ،وألحقهُ بصالح المؤمنين ،واجعلهُ في كفالة إبراهيم ،وقه برحمتك عذاب الجحيم ،وأبدله داراً خيراً من داره ،وأهلاً خيراً من أهله ،اللهم اغفر لاسلافنا ، وأفراطنا ،ومن سبقنا بالإيمان "فحسن
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma a`idh’hu min `adhābi ‘l-qabr  [or say:
duas.en_translation: O Allah, protect him from the torment of the grave.[It is also good to say:]O Allah, make him a precursor, a forerunner and a treasure for his parents and an answered intercessor.O Allah, make him weigh heavily in their scales (of good) and magnify their reward.  Make him join the righteous of the believers.Place him in the care of Ibrahim.Save him by Your mercy from the torment of Hell.Give him a home better than his home,and a family better than his family.O Allah, forgive those who have gone (i.e. passed away) before us, our children lost (by death), and those who have preceded us in Faith.
duas.en_reference: Ibn Qudamah, Al-Mughni 3/416 and Ad-Duroosul-Muhimmah li-Aammatil-'Ummah,pg. 15, by Shaikh 'Abdul-'Aziz bin Baz.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the deceased child at the funeral prayer #2

duas.ar_dua: اللهُـمِّ اجْعَلْـهُ لَنا فَرَطـاً، وَسَلَـفاً وَأَجْـراً
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’j`alhu lanā faraṭan, wa salafan, wa ajra.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, make him for us a precursor, a forerunner and a cause of reward.
duas.en_reference: Al-Hasan (Al-Basri) used to recite Surat Al-Fatihah for a child's funeral and then say this. Al-Bukhari, Kitabul-Jana'iz, p. 65.
duas.subtitle: Condolence

duas.ar_dua: "إن لله ما أخذ  وله ما أعطى .  وكل شيء عنده بأجل مُسمى ...  فلتصبر ولتحتسب "وإن قال :  "أعظم الله أجرك ،  وأحسن عزاءكوغفر لميتك"فحسن
duas.transliteration: Inna lillāhi mā akhadh,wa lahu mā a`tā,wa kullu shay'in `indahu bi ajalin musammā . . .faltaṣbir wa ‘l-taḥtasib . [Also good to say:  A`ẓamallāhu ajrak. wa 'aḥsana `azā'ak. wa ghafara limayyitik.
duas.en_translation: Surely, Allah takes what is His,and what He gives is His,and to all things He has appointed a time...so have patience and be rewarded.(1) May Allah magnify your reward,and make perfect your bereavement,and forgive your departed.(2)
duas.en_reference: (1) Al-Bukhari 2/80, Muslim 2/636.  (2) An-Nawawi, Kitabul-'Athkar, p. 126.
duas.subtitle: Placing the deceased in the grave

duas.ar_dua: بِسْـمِ اللهِوَعَلـى سُـنَّةِ رَسـولِ الله
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh  wa `alā sunnati Rasūlillāh.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah,and according to the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 3/314 with an authentic chain. Ahmad also recorded it with thewording: With the Name of Allah, and according to the religion of theMessenger of Allah. Its chain is also authentic.
duas.subtitle: After burying the deceased

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ  اللَّهُمَّ ثَبِّتْهُ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’ghfir lah  Allāhumma thabbit’h.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, forgive him.O Allah, strengthen him.
duas.en_reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to stop after burying the dead and say to thepeople: "Ask Allah to forgive your brother and pray for him to bestrengthened, for indeed he is now being questioned."Abu Dawud 3/315, andAl-Hakim 1/370 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed.
duas.subtitle: Visiting the graves

duas.ar_dua: السَّلامُ عَلَـيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيارِ مِنَ المؤْمِنيـنَ وَالْمُسْلِمين،وَإِنّا إِنْ شاءَ اللهُ بِكُـمْ لاحِقـون،نَسْـاَلُ اللهَ لنـا وَلَكُـمْ العـافِيَة
duas.transliteration: Assalāmu `alaykum ahlad-diyāri minal-mu'minīna wa ‘l-muslimīn,wa innā in shā' Allāhu bikum lāḥiqūnnas'alullāha lanā wa lakumul-`āfiyah.
duas.en_translation: Peace be upon you, people of this abode, from among the believers and those who are Muslims,and we, by the Will of Allah, shall be joining you.[May Allah have mercy on the first of us and the last of us]I ask Allah to grant us and you well-being.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/671, Ibn Majah 1/494, the portion brackets is from Muslim 2/671.
duas.subtitle: Prayer said during a wind storm #1

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنَّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَيْـرَها،وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّها
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahā,wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for the good of it,and seek refuge in You against its evil.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/326, Ibn Majah 2/1228. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah2/305.
duas.subtitle: Prayer said during a wind storm #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنَّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَيْـرَها،  وَخَيْـرَ ما فيهـا،  وَخَيْـرَ ما اُرْسِلَـتْ بِه،  وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّها،  وَشَـرِّ ما فيهـا،  وَشَـرِّ ما اُرْسِلَـتْ بِه
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahā,wa khayra mā fīhā,wa khayra mā ursilat bih,wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihā,wa sharri mā fīhā,wa sharri mā ursilat bih.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for the good of it,for the good of what it contains,  and for the good of what is sent with it.I seek refuge in You from the evil of it,  from the evil of what it contains,  and from the evil that is sent with it.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/616, Al-Bukhari 4/76.
duas.subtitle: Supplication upon hearing thunder

duas.ar_dua: سُبْـحانَ الّذي يُسَبِّـحُ الـرَّعْدُ بِحَمْـدِهِ،  وَالملائِكـةُ مِنْ خيـفَته
duas.transliteration: Subḥāna ‘l-ladhī yusabbiḥur-ra`du bi ḥamdihiwa ‘l-malā'ikatu min khīfatih.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to Him Whom thunder and angels glorify due to fear of Him.
duas.en_reference: Whenever Abdullah bin Zubair (RA) would hear thunder, he would abandon allconversation and say this supplication. See Al-Muwatta' 2/992. It wasgraded authentic by Al-Albani as a statement of Abdullah bin Zubayr only.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for rain #1

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ اسْقِـنا غَيْـثاً مُغيـثاً مَريئاً مُريـعاً،  نافِعـاً غَيْـرَ ضار،  عاجِـلاً غَـيْرَ آجِل
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ‘asqinā ghaythan mughīthan marī'an murī`a,nāfi`an ghayra ḍārr,`ājilan ghayra ājil.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, shower upon us abundant rain, beneficial not harmful, swiftly and not delayed.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 1/303. See also Al-Albani SahihAbu Dawud 1/216.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for rain #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ أغِثْنـا،اللّهُمَّ أغِثْنـا،اللّهُمَّ أغِثْنـا
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma aghithnā,Allāhumma aghithnā,Allāhumma aghithnā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, send us rain.O Allah, send us rain.O Allah, send us rain.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 2/613.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for rain #3

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ اسْقِ عِبادَكَ وَبَهـائِمَك،وَانْشُـرْ رَحْمَـتَكَوَأَحْيِي بَلَـدَكَ المَيِّـت
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma’sqi `ibādaka wa bahā'imak,wanshur raḥmatak,wa aḥyi baladaka ‘l-mayyit
duas.en_translation: O Allah, give water to Your slaves, and Your livestock,and spread Your mercy,and revive Your dead land.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 1/305. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/218.
duas.subtitle: Supplication when it is raining

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ صَيِّـباً نافِـعاً
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ṣayyiban nāfi`a.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, (bring) beneficial rain clouds.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/518.
duas.subtitle: Supplication after rain

duas.ar_dua: مُطِـرْنا بِفَضْـلِ اللهِ وَرَحْمَـتِه
duas.transliteration: Muṭirnā bifaḍlillāhi wa raḥmatih.
duas.en_translation: We have been given rain by the grace and mercy of Allah.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 1/205, Muslim 1/83.
duas.subtitle: Asking for clear skies

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُمَّ حَوالَيْنا وَلا عَلَيْـنا،  اللّهُمَّ عَلى الآكـامِ وَالظِّـراب،وَبُطـونِ الأوْدِية، وَمَنـابِتِ الشَّجـر
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma ḥawālaynā wa lā `alaynā.Allāhumma `ala ‘l-ākāmi waẓ-ẓirāb,wa buṭūni ‘l-awdiyati, wa manābitish-shajar.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, let the rain fall around us and not upon us,O Allah, (let it fall) on the pastures, hills, valleys, and the roots of trees.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 1/614
duas.subtitle: Upon sighting the crescent moon

duas.ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْـبَر،  اللّهُمَّ أَهِلَّـهُ عَلَيْـنا بِالأمْـنِ وَالإيمـان،  والسَّلامَـةِ والإسْلام،  وَالتَّـوْفيـقِ لِما تُحِـبُّ رَبَّنـا وَتَـرْضـى،رَبُّنـا وَرَبُّكَ الله
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar,Allāhumma ahillahu `alayna bi ‘l-amni wa ‘l-īmān,  was-salāmati wa ‘l-'Islām,wat-tawfīqi limā tuḥibbu Rabbanā wa tarḍā,Rabbunā wa Rabbukallāh.
duas.en_translation: Allah is the Most Great.O Allah, bring us the new moon with security and Faith,with peace and in Islam,and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him.Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi3/157.
duas.subtitle: Upon breaking fast #1

duas.ar_dua: ذَهَـبَ الظَّمَـأُ،  وَابْتَلَّـتِ العُـروق،  وَثَبَـتَ الأجْـرُ إِنْ شـاءَ الله
duas.transliteration: Dhahabaẓ-ẓama',wabtallati ‘l-`urūq,wa thabata ‘l-'ajru in shā Allāh.
duas.en_translation: The thirst is gone,  the veins are moistened,and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir4/209.
duas.subtitle: Upon breaking fast #2

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنَّـي أَسْـأَلُـكَ بِرَحْمَـتِكَ الّتي وَسِـعَت كُلَّ شيء،أَنْ تَغْـفِرَ لي
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'alukabi raḥmatika ‘l-latī wasi`at kulla shay'an taghfira lī.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things, that You forgive me.
duas.en_reference: Ibn Majah 1/557 from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh gradedit as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul-Athkar 4/342.
duas.subtitle: Supplication before eating #1

duas.ar_dua: إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ طَعَاماً فَلْيَقُلْبِسْمِ اللَّهِ،  فَإِنْ نَسِيَ فِي أَوَّلِهِ فَلْيَقُلْبسمِ اللَّهِ فِي أَوَّلِهِ وَآخِرِهِ
duas.transliteration: When anyone of you begins eating, say:
duas.en_translation: When anyone of you begins eating, say: With the Name of Allah. And if you forget then, when you remember, say: With the Name of Allah, in the beginning, and in the end.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 3/347, At-Tirmidhi 4/288. See Al- Albani's Sahih At-Tirmidhi2/167.
duas.subtitle: Supplication before eating #2

duas.ar_dua: مَنْ أَطْعَمَهُ اللَّهُ الطَّعَامَ فَلْيَقُلْ:  "اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ  وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ"،  وَمَنْ سَقَاهُ اللَّهُ لَبَناً فَلْيَقُلْ  "اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ  وَزِدْنَا مِنْهُ"
duas.transliteration: Whomever Allah has given food, should say: Allāhumma bārik lanā fīhi. wa aṭ`imnā khayran minh. Whomever Allah has given milk to drink, should say :Allāhumma bārik lanā fīhi. wa zidnā minh.
duas.en_translation: Whomever Allah has given food, should say: O Allah, bless us in it and provide us with better than it. Whomever Allah has given milk to drink, should say : O Allah, bless us in it and give us more of it.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/506. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/158.
duas.subtitle: Upon completion of a meal #1

duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْـدُ للهِ الَّذي أَطْعَمَنـي هـذا  وَرَزَقَنـيهِ مِنْ غَـيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلا قُوَّة
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillāhi ‘l-ladhī aṭ`amanī hādhā,wa razaqanīhi min ghayri ḥawlin minnī wa lā quwwah.
duas.en_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has given me this food,and sustained me with it though I was unable to do it and powerless.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/159.
duas.subtitle: Upon completion of a meal #2

duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْـدُ للهِ حَمْـداً كَثـيراً طَيِّـباً مُبـارَكاً فيه،  غَيْرَ مَكْفِيٍّ وَلا مُوَدَّعٍ وَلا مُسْتَغْـنىً عَنْـهُ رَبَّـنا
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillāhi ḥamdan kathīran tayyiban mubārakan fīh,ghayra makfiyyin wa lā muwadda`in,wa lā mustaghnan `anhu Rabbanā.
duas.en_translation: All praise is to Allah, praise in abundance, good and blessed. It cannot [be compensated for, nor can it] be left, nor can it be done without, our Lord.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 6/214, At-Tirmidhi 5/507.
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the guest for the host

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ بارِكْ لَهُمْ فيما رَزَقْـتَهُم،وَاغْفِـرْ لَهُـمْ وَارْحَمْهُمْ
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma bārik lahum fī mā razaqtahum,wagh’fir lahum warḥamhum.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, bless them in what You have provided for them,and forgive them and have mercy on them.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 3/1615.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said to one offering a drink or to one who intended to do that

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ أَطْعِمْ مَن أَطْعَمَني،وَاسْقِ مَن سقاني
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma aṭ`im man aṭ`amanīwasqi man saqānī.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, feed the one who has fed me,  and give drink to the one who has given me drink.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 3/126.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said when breaking fast in someone's home

duas.ar_dua: أَفْطَـرَ عِنْدَكُم الصّـائِمونَ  وَأَكَلَ طَعامَـكُمُ الأبْـرار،  وَصَلَّـتْ عَلَـيْكُمُ الملائِكَـة
duas.transliteration: Afṭara `indakumuṣ-ṣā'imūn,wa akala ṭa`āmakumu ‘l-'abrār,wa ṣallat `alaykumu ‘l-malā'ikah.
duas.en_translation: With you, those who are fasting have broken their fast,you have fed those who are righteous,and the angels recite their prayers upon you.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 3/367, Ibn Majah 1/556, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah 296-8.Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/730.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said by one fasting when presented with food and does not break his fast

duas.ar_dua: (إِذَا دُعِيَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيُجِبْ، فَإِنْ كَانَ صَائِماً فَلْيُصَلِّ، وَإِنْ كَانَ مُفْطِراً فَلْيَطْعَمْ) ، وَمَعْنَى فَلْيُصَلِّ أَيْ فَلْيَدْعُ.
duas.en_translation: When you are invited (to eat) then reply to the invitation.If you are fasting then invoke Allah's blessings (on your host),and if you are not fasting then eat.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/1054.
duas.subtitle: If insulted while fasting #1

duas.ar_dua: إِنِّي صَائِمٌ،إِنِّي صَائِمٌ
duas.transliteration: Innī  ṣā'im,  innī  ṣā'im.
duas.en_translation: I am fasting.I am fasting.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-BAri 4/103, Muslim 2/806.
duas.subtitle: What to say when insulted while fasting

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ بارِكْ لَنا في ثَمَـرِنا،  وَبارِكْ لَنا في مَدينَتِنـا،  وَبارِكْ لَنا في صاعِنـا،  وَبارِكْ لَنا في مُدِّنا
duas.transliteration: Allahumma bārik lanā fī thamarinā,wa bārik lanā fī madīnatināwa bārik lanā fī  ṣā`inā,wa bārik lanā fī muddinā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, bless us in our dates and bless us in our town,bless us in our Sa' and in our Mudd.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/1000 (Sa' and Mudd are both dry measures used for agriculturalproduce by the Arabs in the Prophet's time. Of the two, the So.' was thelarger measure.) (Translator)
duas.subtitle: Upon seeing the early or premature fruit

duas.ar_dua: إِذَا عَطَسَ أَحَدُكُم فَلْيَقُلِ (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَلْيَقُلْ لَهُ أَخُوهُ أَوْ صَاحِبُهُ: (يَرْحَمُكَ اللَّهُ)، فَإِذَا قَالَ لَهُ: (يَرحَمُكَ اللَّهُ)، فَلْيَقُلْ: (يَهْدِيكُمُ اللَّهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ)
duas.transliteration:
When you sneeze, say: Alḥamdulillāh 
Your companion should say: Yarḥamukallāh 
When someone says Yarḥamukallāh to you then you should say: Yahdīkumu ‘llāhu wa yuṣliḥu bālakum.
duas.en_translation:
When you sneeze, then say:  All praises and thanks are to Allah. 
Your companion should say:  May Allah have mercy upon you. 
When someone says Yarḥamukallāh to you then you should say:  May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/125.
duas.subtitle: Sneezing

duas.ar_dua: يَهْـديكُـمُ اللهُ وَيُصْـلِحُ بالَـكُم
duas.transliteration: Yahdīkumullāhu wa yuṣliḥu bālakum.
duas.en_translation: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/82, Ahmad 4/400, Abu Dawud 4/ 308. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 2/354.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said to the newly wed

duas.ar_dua: بارَكَ اللّهُ لَك،وَبارَكَ عَلَـيْك،وَجَمَعَ بَيْـنَكُما في خَـيْر
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu lak,wa bāraka `alayk,wa jama`a baynakumā fī khayr.
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you,  and shower His blessings upon you,and join you together in goodness.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi1/316.
duas.subtitle: The groom's supplication on the wedding night or when buying an animal

duas.ar_dua: إِذَا تَزَوَّجَ أَحَدُكُمُ امْرَأَةً، أَوْ إِذَا اشْتَرَى خَادِماً فَلْيَقُلْ:(اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا،وَخَيْرَ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ،وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا،وَشَرِّ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ)،وَإِذَا اشْتَرَى بَعِيراً فَلْيَأْخُذْ بِذِرْوَةِ سَنَامِهِ وَلْيَقُلْ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ.
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī as'aluka khayrahāwa khayra mā jabaltahā `alayh. wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihāwa sharri mā jabaltahā `alayh.
duas.en_translation: When any of you marries a woman or purchases a maid-servant then let him say : O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of her,  and the goodness upon which You have created her,  and I seek refuge in You from the evil of her,and from the evil upon which You have created her. If you purchase a camel then take hold of the top of its hump and say the same.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/248 and Ibn Majah 1/617. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/324.
duas.subtitle: On the wedding night or when buying an animal

duas.ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهاللّهُـمَّ جَنِّبْنا الشَّيْـطانَ،وَجَنِّبِ الشَّـيْطانَ ما رَزَقْـتَنا
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh.Allāhumma jannibnash-Shayṭān,wa jannibish-Shayṭāna mā razaqtanā.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah.O Allah, keep the Devil away from us,and keep the Devil away from that which You provide for us.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 6/141, Muslim 2/1028.
duas.subtitle: Before Sex (Sexual Intercourse) with one’s wife

duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِاللهِ مِنَ الشَّيْـطانِ الرَّجيـم
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu billāhi minash-Shayṭānir-rajīm.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/99, Muslim 4/2015.
duas.subtitle: When Angry

duas.ar_dua: الْحَمْـدُ للهِ الّذي عافاني مِمّا ابْتَـلاكَ بِهِ،  وَفَضَّلَـني عَلى كَثيـرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَـقَ تَفْضـيلا
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillāhi ‘l-ladhī `āfānī mimmab-talāka bihiwa faḍḍalanī `alā kathīrin mimman khalaqa tafḍīlā.
duas.en_translation: Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with,and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/493,4. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/153.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance said at a sitting or gathering, etc...

duas.ar_dua: عن ابن عمر قال : كان يعد لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم في المجلس الواحد مائة مرة من قبل أن يقوم"رب اغفر ليوتب عليإنك أنت التواب الغفور"
duas.transliteration: Ibn Umar (ra) said:
duas.en_translation: Ibn Umar (ra) said: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to repeat in a single sitting: My Lord, forgive me,  and accept my repentance,You are the Ever-Relenting, the All-Forgiving.
duas.en_reference: Sahih Ibn Majah 2/321. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/153.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for the expiation of sins said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering, etc...

duas.ar_dua: سُبْحـانَكَ اللّهُـمَّ وَبِحَمدِك،أَشْهَـدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ أَنْتَأَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتوبُ إِلَـيْك
duas.transliteration: Subhānaka Allāhumma wa biḥamdik,ash-hadu an lā ilāha illā ant,  astaghfiruka wa atību ilayk.
duas.en_translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise is to You.I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You.I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi and An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/ 153. Aishah (RA) said: "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) did not sitin a gathering, and did not recite the Qur'an, and did not perform anyprayer without concluding by saying ... (then she quoted the above)."Thiswas reported by An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no.308), and Dr.Farooq Hamadah graded it authentic in his checking of the same book, p.273. See also Ahmad 6/77
duas.subtitle: Replying to a supplication of forgiveness #1

duas.ar_dua: وَلَكَ
duas.transliteration: Walaka
duas.en_translation: And you.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 5/82, and An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 218, with checkingby Dr. Farooq Hamadah.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said to one who does you a favor

duas.ar_dua: جَزاكَ اللهُ خَـيْراً
duas.transliteration: Jazākallāhu khayra.
duas.en_translation: May Allah reward you with good.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi (no. 2035). See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/200 andSahihul-Jami' (no. 6244).
duas.subtitle: Protection from the Dajjâl

duas.ar_dua: .(مَنْ حَفِظَ عَشْرَ آيَاتٍ مِنْ أَوَّلِ سُورَةِ الْكَهْفِ عُصِمَ مِنَ الدَّجَّالِ) ، وَالْاسْتِعَاذَةُ بِاللَّهِ مِنْ فِتْنَتِهِ عَقِبَ التَّشَهُّدِ الْأَخِيرِ مِنْ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ.
duas.en_translation: Whoever memorizes ten 'Ayat (Verses) from the beginning of Surat Al-Kahf, will be protected from the False Messiah 1if he recites in every prayer after the final Tashahhud before ending the prayer, seeking the protection of Allah from the trials of the False Messiah.
duas.en_reference: 1 Muslim 1/555, another version mentions the last ten 'Ayat, Muslim 1/556.  2 See invocations no. 55 and 56 of this book.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said to one who pronounces his love for you, for Allah's sake

duas.ar_dua: أَحَبَّـكَ الّذي أَحْبَبْـتَني لَه
duas.transliteration: Aḥabbaka ‘lladhī aḥbabtanī lah.
duas.en_translation: May He for Whose sake you love me, love you.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/333. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/965.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said to one who has offered you some of his wealth

duas.ar_dua: بارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ في أَهْلِكَ وَمالِك
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu laka fī ahlika wa mālik.
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you in your family and your property.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-BAri 4/88.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said to the debtor when his debt is settled

duas.ar_dua: بارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ في أَهْلِكَ وَمالِك،إِنَّما جَـزاءُ السَّلَفِ الْحَمْدُ والأَداء
duas.transliteration: Bārakallāhu laka fī ahlika wa mālik,innamā jazā'us-salafi ‘l-ḥamdu wa‘l-adā'.
duas.en_translation: May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth,surely the reward for a loan is praise and returning (what was borrowed).
duas.en_reference: An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylahp. 300, Ibn Majah 2/809. See alsoAl-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah2/55.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for fear of Shirk

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ إِنّـي أَعـوذُبِكَ أَنْ أُشْـرِكَ بِكَ وَأَنا أَعْـلَمْ،وَأَسْتَـغْفِرُكَ لِما لا أَعْـلَم
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika an ushrika bika wa anā a`lam,wa astaghfiruka limā lā a`lam.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I associate anything with You knowingly,and I seek Your forgiveness for what I know not.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 4/403. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 3/233 andSahihut-Targhib wat- Tarhib 1/19.
duas.subtitle: Returning a supplication after having bestowed a gift or charity upon someone

duas.ar_dua: وَفيكَ بارَكَ الله
duas.transliteration: Wafīka bārakallāh.
duas.en_translation: And may Allah bless you.
duas.en_reference: Ibn As-Sunni, p. 138, (no. 278). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Al-WdbilAs-Sayyib, p. 304, with checking by Basheer Muhammad ?Uyoon.
duas.subtitle: Forbiddance of ascribing things to omens

duas.ar_dua: اللّهُـمَّ لا طَيْـرَ إِلاّ طَيْـرُك،وَلا خَـيْرَ إِلاّ خَـيْرُك،وَلا إِلهَ غَيْـرُك
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma lā ṭayra illā ṭayruk,wa lā khayra illā khayruk,wa lā ilāha ghayruk.
duas.en_translation: O Allah there is no portent other than Your portent,no goodness other than Your goodness,and none worthy of worship other than You.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 2/220, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 292). See also Al-Albani,Silsilatul-'Ahadlth As-Sahihah 3/54, (no. 1065).
