As for bodings of good,these used to please the Prophet (ﷺ) and so when he heard good words fromsomeone, he used to say: "We have taken from you a good portent from yourmouth,"Abu Dawud, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'AhadithAs-Sahihah 2/363, and it is with Abu Ash-Shaikh Al-Asfahani in'Akhlaqun-Nabiyy, pg. 270.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said when mounting an animal or any means of transport

duas.ar_dua: بِسْـمِ اللهِ  وَالْحَمْـدُ لله،  ﴿سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ *  وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ﴾  الحَمْـدُ لله، الحَمْـدُ لله، الحَمْـدُ لله،  اللهُ أكْـبَر، اللهُ أكْـبَر، اللهُ أكْـبَر،سُـبْحانَكَ اللّهُـمَّ إِنّي ظَلَـمْتُ نَفْسي  فَاغْـفِرْ لي،  فَإِنَّهُ لا يَغْفِـرُ الذُّنوبَ إِلاّ أَنْـت
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh,walḥamdulillāh.Subḥāna ‘lladhī sakhkhara lanā hādhā  wa mā kunnā lahu muqrinīn.Wa innā ilā Rabbinā lamunqalibūn.Alḥamdulillāh, alḥamdulillāh, alḥamdulillāh,Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar,Subḥānaka ‘llāhumma innī ẓalamtu nafsī,faghfir lī,fa innahu lā yaghfirudh-dhunūba illā ant.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah.Praise is to Allah.Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us  though we could never have had it by our efforts.Surely, unto our Lord, we are returning.  Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah. Praise is to Allah.Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the MostGreat. Allah is the Most Great.Glory is to You. O Allah, I have wronged my own soul.Forgive me,for surely none forgives sins but You.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 3/34, At-Tirmidhi 5/501. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi3/156.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for travel

duas.ar_dua: "اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ،  ﴿سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ *  وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ﴾  اللَّهُمَّ إِنّا نَسْأَلُكَ فِي سَفَرِنَا هَذَا البِرَّ وَالتَّقْوَى،  وَمِنَ الْعَمَلِ مَا تَرْضَى،  اللَّهُمَّ هَوِّنْ عَلَيْنَا سَفَرَنَا هَذَا  وَاطْوِ عَنَّا بُعْدَهُ،  اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الصَّاحِبُ فِي السَّفَرِ،  وَالْخَليفَةُ فِي الْأَهْلِ،  اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ وَعْثَاءِ السَّفَرِ،  وَكَآبَةِ الْمَنْظَرِ،  وَسُوءِ الْمُنْقَلَبِ فِي الْمَالِ وَالْأَهْلِ"، وإذا رَجَعَ قَالَهُنَّ وَزَادَ فِيهِنَّ:  "آيِبُونَ، تائِبُونَ، عَابِدُونَ،  لِرَبِّنَا حَامِدُونَ".
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar, Allāhu Akbar,Subḥāna ‘l-ladhi sakhkhara lanā hādhāwa mā kunnā lahu muqrinīn.Wa innā ilā Rabbinā lamunqalibūn.Allāhumma innā nas'aluka fī safarinā hādha ‘l-birra wat-taqwā,Wa mina ‘l-`amali mā tarḍā,Allāhumma hawwin `alaynā safaranā hādhā  waṭwi `annā bu`dah,Allāhumma antas-sāḥibu fis-safar,wa ‘l-khalīfatu fil-ahl,Allāhumma innī a`ūdhu bika min wa`thā'is-safar,wa ka'ābati ‘l-manẓar,wa sū'il-munqalabi fil-māli wa ‘l-ahl. (Upon returning recite the same again adding):
duas.en_translation: Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great. Allah is the Most Great.Glory is to Him Who has provided this for us  though we could never have had it by our efforts.Surely, unto our Lord we are returning.O Allah, we ask You on this our journey for goodness and piety,and for works that are pleasing to You.O Allah, lighten this journey for us  and make its distance easy for us.O Allah, You are our Companion on the road  and the One in Whose care we leave our family.O Allah, I seek refuge in You from this journey's hardships,  and from the wicked sights in storeand from finding our family and property in misfortune upon returning. (Upon returning recite the same again adding :) We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord,  and praising our Lord.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/978.
duas.subtitle: Supplication upon entering a town or village, etc...

duas.ar_dua: أللّـهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّـمواتِ السّـبْعِ وَما أَظْلَلَـن،  وَرَبَّ الأَراضيـنَ السّـبْعِ وَما أقْلَلْـن،  وَرَبَّ الشَّيـاطينِ وَما أَضْلَلْـن،  وَرَبَّ الرِّياحِ وَما ذَرَيْـن،  أَسْـأَلُـكَ خَيْـرَ هذهِ الْقَـرْيَةِ  وَخَيْـرَ أَهْلِـها،  وَخَيْـرَ ما فيها،  وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّها  وَشَـرِّ أَهْلِـها،  وَشَـرِّ ما فيها
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma Rabbas-samāwātis-sab`i wa mā aẓlaln,Wa Rabba ‘l-arāḍīnas-sab`i wa mā aqlaln,wa Rabbash-shayāṭīni wa mā aḍlaln,wa Rabbar-riyāḥi wa mā dharayn.As'aluka khayra hādhihi ‘l-qaryah,wa khayra ahlihā,wa khayra māfīhā,wa a`ūdhu bika min sharrihā,wa sharri ahlihā,wa sharri mā fīhā.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and all they overshadow,  Lord of the seven worlds and all they uphold,Lord of the devils and all they lead astray,  Lord of the winds and all they scatter.I ask You for the goodness of this town,and for the goodness of its people,and for the goodness it contains.I seek refuge in You from its evil,from the evil of its people,and from the evil it contains.
duas.en_reference: Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tfaahabi agreed 2/100, and IbnAs-Sunni (no. 524). Al-Hafidh graded it good in his checking of Al-'Athkdr5/154. Ibn Baz said in Tuhfatul-'Akhydr p. 37, that An-Nasa'i recorded itwith a good chain of narration.
duas.subtitle: When entering the market

duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّه  وحدَهُ لا شريكَ لهُ،  لهُ المُلْـكُ ولهُ الحَمْـد،يُحْيـي وَيُميـتُ  وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لا يَمـوت،  بِيَـدِهِ الْخَـيْرُ  وَهوَ على كلّ شيءٍ قدير
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh  waḥdahu lā sharīka lah,Lahu ‘l-mulku wa lahu ‘l-ḥamd,Yuḥyī wa yumīt,wa huwa ḥayyun lā yamūt,  Biyadihi ‘l-khayr,wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in Qadīr.
duas.en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone,Who has no partner.  His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death,and He is living and does not die.In His Hand is all good,and He is Able to do all things.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/291, and Al-Hakim 1/538. Al-Albani graded it good in SahihIbn Majah 2/21 and Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/152.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for when the mounted animal (or means of transport) stumbles

duas.ar_dua: بِسْـمِ اللهِ
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/296. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/941.
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the traveller for the resident

duas.ar_dua: أَسْتَـوْدِعُكُـمُ اللَّهَ الَّذي لا تَضـيعُ وَدائِعُـه
duas.transliteration: Astawdi`ukumu ‘llāha ‘l-ladhi lā taḍī`u wadā'i`uh.
duas.en_translation: I place you in the trust of Allah, whose trust is never misplaced.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 2/403, Ibn Majah 2/943. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/133.
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the resident for the traveller #1

duas.ar_dua: أَسْتَـوْدِعُ اللَّهَ ديـنَكَ  وَأَمانَتَـكَ،وَخَـواتيـمَ عَمَـلِك
duas.transliteration: Astawdi`ullāha dīnak,wa amānatak,wa khawātīma `amalik.
duas.en_translation: I leave your religion in the care of Allah,as well as your safety,and the last of your deeds.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 2/7, At-Tirmidhi 5/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 2/155.
duas.subtitle: Supplication of the resident for the traveller #2

duas.ar_dua: زَوَّدَكَ اللَّهُ التقْوى،وَغَفَـرَذَنْـبَكَ،وَيَسَّـرَ لَكَ الخَـيْرَ حَيْـثُما كُنْـت
duas.transliteration: Zawwadaka ‘llāhut-taqwā,wa ghafara dhanbak,wa yassara laka ‘l-khayra ḥaythu mā kunt.
duas.en_translation: May Allah give you piety as your provision,forgive your sins,and make goodness easy for you wherever you are.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi, 3/155.
duas.subtitle: Remembrance while ascending or descending

duas.ar_dua: قَالَ جَابِرٌ رضي الله عنه:(كُنَّا إِذَا صَعَدْنَا كَبَّرْنَا،وَإِذَا نَزَلْنَا سَبَّحْنَا)
duas.en_translation: Jabir (ra), said:
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/135.
duas.subtitle: Prayer of the traveller as dawn approaches

duas.ar_dua: سَمِـعَ سـامِعٌ بِحَمْـدِ اللهِ وَحُسْـنِ بَلائِـهِ عَلَيْـنا.  رَبَّنـا صـاحِبْـنا وَأَفْـضِل عَلَيْـناعائِذاً باللهِ مِنَ النّـار
duas.transliteration: Sami`a sāmi`un biḥamdillāhi wa ḥusni balā'ihi `alaynā.Rabbanā ṣāḥibnā, wa afḍil `alaynā,`ā'idhan billāhi minan-nār.
duas.en_translation: He Who listens has heard that we praise Allah for the good things He gives us.Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us.I seek the protection of Allah from the Fire.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2086, the meaning of sami`a sāmi`un (who listens has heard) isthat 'a witness has witnessed our praise of Allah due to His blessings andfavor upon us.' It could also be read samma`a sāmi`un, in which case itmeans 'one who has heard this statement of mine will convey it to anotherand he will say it as well.' This is due to the attention given to theThikr (remembrance of Allah) and supplications made during the earlymorning hours. The meaning of his saying 'Our Lord, be with us and bestowYour favor upon us' is: 'Our Lord, protect us and guard us. Bless us withYour numerous bounties, and avert from us every evil.' See An-Nawawi, SharhSahih Muslim 17/39.
duas.subtitle: Stopping or lodging somewhere

duas.ar_dua: أَعـوذُ بِكَلِـماتِ اللّهِ التّـامّاتِ مِنْ شَـرِّ ما خَلَـق
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti min sharri mā khalaq.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2080.
duas.subtitle: While returning from travel

duas.ar_dua: يُكَبِّرُ عَلَى كُلِّ شَرَفٍ ثَلاَثَ تَكْبِيرَاتٍ ثُمَّ يَقُولُ:لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُوَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ،لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ،وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ،آيِبُونَ، تَائِبُونَ، عَابِدُونَ،لِرَبِّنا حَامِدُونَ،صَدَقَ اللَّهُ وَعْدَهُ،وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ،وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزابَ وَحْدَهُ
duas.transliteration: From every elevated point sayAllāhu Akbar (three times),and then recite:
duas.en_translation: From every elevated point say Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) three times and then recite: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone,Who has no partner.His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.We return repentant to our Lord, worshipping our Lord,and praising our Lord.He fulfilled His Promise,He aided His slave,and He alone defeated the Confederates.
duas.en_reference: Bukhari 7/163, Muslim 2/980. The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say this whenreturning from a campaign or from Hajj.
duas.subtitle: Supplication after receiving good or bad news

duas.ar_dua: كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ الْأَمْرُ يَسُرُّهُ قَالَ: (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ) وَإِذَا أَتَاهُ الْأَمْرُ يَكْرَهُهُ قَالَ: (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ)
duas.transliteration: When something happened that pleased him, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say:
duas.en_translation: When something happened that pleased him, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say:  Praise is to Allah Who by His blessings all good things are perfected. And if something happened that displeased him, he used to say:  Praise is to Allah in all circumstances.
duas.en_reference: Ibn As-Sunni, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic1/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/201.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #1

duas.ar_dua: قَالَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (مَنْ صَلَّى عَلَيَّ صَلاَةً صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ بِهَا عَشْراً)
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 1/288.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #2

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (لاَ تَجْعَلُوا قَبْرِي عِيداً وَصَلُّوا عَلَيَّ؛ فَإِنَّ صَلاَتَكُم تَبْلُغُنِي حَيْثُ كُنْتُمْ)
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/218, Ahmad 2/367. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih AbuDawud 2/383.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #3

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (الْبَخِيلُ مَنْ ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيَّ)
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/551 and others. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/177and Sahihul-Jarai' As-Saghir 3/25.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #4

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم:(إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَلاَئِكَةً سَيَّاحِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يُبَلِّغُونِي مِنْ أُمَّتِي السَّلاَمَ)
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim 2/421. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih An-Nasa'i1/274.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #5

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (مَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ يُسَلِّمُ عَلَيَّ إِلاَّ رَدَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيَّ رُوحِيَ حَتَّى أَرُدَّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلاَمَ)
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud (no. 2041). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/383.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #1

duas.ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (لاَ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوا، وَلاَ تُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا، أَوَلاَ أَدُلُّكُم عَلَى شَيْءٍ إِذَا فَعَلْتُمُوهُ تَحَابَبْتُم، أَفْشُوا السَّلاَمَ بَيْنَكُمْ)
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 1/74 and others.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #2

duas.ar_dua: ثَلاَثٌ مَنْ جَمَعَهُنَّ فَقَدْ جَمَعَ الْإِيمَانَ: الْإِنْصَافُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ، وَبَذْلُ السَّلاَمِ لِلْعَالَمِ، وَالْإِنْفَاقُ مِنَ الإِقْتَارِ
duas.transliteration: Which Islam is the best?’.  He ﷺ replied: Feed (the poor), and greet those whom you know as well as those whom you do not.(version of Abdullah ibn Amr (ra))
duas.en_translation: Three characteristics, whoever combines them, has completed his faith:1. to be just,2. to spread greetings to all people and3. to spend (charitably) out of the little you have.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/82 as a statement of theCompanion 'Ammar (RA).
duas.subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #3

duas.ar_dua: وَعَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمَا: أنَّ رَجُلاً سَأَلَ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أيُّ الْإِسْلاَمِ خَيْرٌ قَالَ: (تُطْعِمُ الطَّعَامَ، وَتَقْرأُ السَّلاَمَ عَلَى مَنْ عَرَفْتَ وَمَنْ لَمْ تَعْرِفْ)
duas.en_translation: `Abdullah bin `Umar (RA) said:
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/55, Muslim 1/65.
duas.subtitle: How to reply to the Salâm of a Kâfir (non-Muslim)

duas.ar_dua: إذَا سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ فَقُولُوا: وَعَلَيْكُمْ
duas.transliteration: If one of the People of the Scripture (i.e. Christians and Jews) greets you, saying As-Salāmu `alaykum, then say (to him):
duas.en_translation: If one of the People of the Scripture (i.e. Christians and Jews) greets you saying As-Salaamu `alaykum, then say (to him): And upon you .
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/42, Muslim 4/1705.
duas.subtitle: Supplication after hearing a rooster crow or a donkey bray

duas.ar_dua: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ صِيَاحَ الدِّيَكَةِ فَاسْأَلُوا اللَّهَ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ؛ فَإِنَّهَا رَأَتْ مَلَكاً وَإِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نَهِيقَ الْحِمَارِ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ؛ فَإِنَّهُ رَأَى شَيْطَاناً
duas.en_translation: When you hear the cock's crow, ask Allah for His favor upon you for surely it has seen an angel. When you hear the bray of a donkey, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, for surely it has seen a devil.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/350, Muslim 4/2092.
duas.subtitle: Supplication upon hearing the barking of dogs at night

duas.ar_dua: إِذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نُبَاحَ الْكِلاَبِ وَنَهِيقَ الْحَمِيرِ بِاللَّيْلِ فَتَعَوَّذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنْهُنَّ؛ فَإِنَّهُنَّ يَرَيْنَ مَا لاَ تَرَوْنَ
duas.en_translation: When you hear a dog barking or a donkey braying in the night, then seek refuge in Allah from them, for surely they have seen what you see not.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 4/327, Ahmad 3/306. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih AbuDawud 3/961.
duas.subtitle: Supplication said for one you have insulted

duas.ar_dua: قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: "اللَّهُم فأيما مؤمن سببته فاجعل ذلك له قربة إليك يوم القيامة"
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma fa'ayyumā mu'minin sababtuhufaj`al dhālika lahu qurbatan ilayka yawma ‘l-qiyāmah.
duas.en_translation: O Allah, whomever of the believers I have abused, give him the reward of a sacrificial slaughter for it on the Day of Resurrection.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/171, Muslim 4/2007. The wordingin Muslim's report is: 'make it a purification for him and a source ofmercy.
duas.subtitle: The etiquette of praising a fellow Muslim

duas.ar_dua: قال صلى الله عليه وسلم: "إِذَا كَانَ أَحَدُكُم مَادِحاً صَاحِبَهُ لاَ مَحَالَةَ فَلْيَقُلْ: أَحْسِبُ فُلاَناً وَاللَّهُ حَسِيبُهُ، وَلاَ أُزَكِّي عَلَى اللَّهِ أَحَداً، أَحْسِبُهُ – إِنْ كَانَ يَعْلَمُ ذَاكَ – كَذَا وَكَذَا"
duas.transliteration: If any of you praises his companion then let him say:
duas.en_translation: If any of you praises his companion then let him say:  I consider (such and such a person), and Allah is his Assessor, (meaning: and I cannot claim anyone to be pious before Allah) if you know of this (good character trait in the person) to be such and such (saying what he thinks is praiseworthy in that person).
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2296.
duas.subtitle: For the one that has been praised

duas.ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنِي بِمَا يَقُولُونَ وَاغْفِرْ لِي مَا لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ [وَاجْعَلْنِي خَيْرًا مِمَّا يَظُّنُّونَ]
duas.transliteration: Allāhumma lā tu'ākhidhnī bimā yaqūlūn,waghfir lī mā lā ya`lamūn  [waj`alnī khayran mimmā yaẓunnūn].
duas.en_translation: O Allah, do not call me to account for what they say  and forgive me for what they have no knowledge of[and make me better than they imagine].
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adabul-Mufrad no. 761. See Al-Albani, SahihAl-'Adabul-Mufrad (no. 585). The portion between brackets if fromAl-Bayhaqi, Shu'ab Al-Iman 4/228, and comes another account.
duas.subtitle: The Talbiyah for the one doing Ĥajj or 'Umra

duas.ar_dua: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ،لَبَّيْكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ،إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ والنِّعْمَة لَكَ والمُلْكُ،لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ
duas.transliteration: Labbayk-Allāhumma labbayk,labbayka lā sharīka laka labbayk,  inna ‘l-ḥamda, wanni`mata, laka wa ‘l-mulk,lā sharīka lak.
duas.en_translation: I am here at Your service, O Allah, I am here at Your service.I am here at Your service, You have no partner, I am here at Your service.Surely the praise, and blessings are Yours, and the dominion.You have no partner.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/408, Muslim 2/841.
duas.subtitle: The Takbîr passing the black stone

duas.ar_dua: طَافَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِالْبَيْتِ عَلَى بَعِيرٍ كُلَّمَا أَتَى الرُّكْنَ أَشَارَ إِلَيْهِ بِشَيْءٍ عِنْدَهُ وَكَبَّرَ
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) performed Tawaf riding a camel. Every time he passed the corner (containing the Black Stone), he would point to it with something that he was holding and say:
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/476. See also 472. The'something' that was referred to in this Hadith was a cane.
duas.subtitle: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone

duas.ar_dua: ﴿رَبَّنَا آتِنَا في الدُّنْيَا حسَنَةً  وفي الآخِرَةِ حسَنةًوقِنَا عذَابَ النَّارِ﴾
duas.transliteration: Rabbanā ātinā fid-dunyā ḥasanahwa fi ‘l-ākhirati ḥasanahwa qinā `adhāban-nār.
duas.en_translation: Our Lord, grant us the good things in this world,  and the good things in the next life,  and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/179, Ahmad 3/411, Al-Baghawi, Sharhus-Sunnah 7/128. Al-Albanigraded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/354. The Ayat is from Surat Al-Baqarah,2:201.
duas.subtitle: When at Mount Ŝaffâ and Mount Marwah

duas.ar_dua: (لَمَّا دَنَا النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِنَ الصَّفَا قَرَأَ: ﴿إِنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَآئِرِ اللَّهِ﴾ "أَبْدَأُ بِمَا بَدَأَ اللَّهُ بِهِ"فَبَدَأَ بِالصَّفَا فَرَقِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى رَأَى الْبَيْتَ، فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ، فَوَحَّدَ اللَّهَ وَكبَّرَهُ وَقَالَ: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ، أَنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ، وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ، وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ، ثُمَّ دَعَا بَيْنَ ذلكَ. قَالَ مِثْلَ هَذَا ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ) الْحَدِيثُ. وَفِيهِ: (فَفَعَلَ عَلَى الْمَرْوَةِ كَمَا فَعَلَ عَلَى الصَّفَا)
duas.transliteration: Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite:
duas.en_translation: Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite: Surely Safa and Marwah are among the signs of Allah. I begin by that which Allah began. He began (his Sa'y) at Mount Safa climbing it until he could see the House. He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great. Then he said: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated Confederates. Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same thing like this three times. He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/888.
duas.subtitle: On the Day of 'Arafah

duas.ar_dua: خير الدعاء دعاء يوم عرفة ، وخيرُ ما قلت أنا والنبيُّون من قبلي :  لا إله إلا الله وحدهُ  لا شريك لهُ ،  لهُ الملكُ ولهُ الحمدُ  وهو على كل شيء قدير.
duas.transliteration: Lā 'ilāha 'illallāhuwaḥdahu lā sharīka lahu,lahul-mulku wa lahul-ḥamduwa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped but AllahAlone, Who has no partner.His is the dominion and His is the praise,  and He is Able to do all things.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/184, and alsoSilsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 4/6.
duas.subtitle: At the Sacred Site (Al-Mash'ar Al-Harâm)

duas.ar_dua: رَكِبَ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْقَصْوَاءَ حَتَّى أَتَى الْمَشْعَرَ الْحَرَامَ فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ (فَدَعَاهُ، وَكَبَّرَهُ، وَهَللَّهُ، وَوَحَّدَهُ) فَلَمْ يَزَلْ وَاقِفاً حَتَّى أَسْفَرَ جِدَّاً فَدَفَعَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَطْلُعَ الشَّمسُ.
duas.en_translation: 'He (ﷺ) rode Al-Qaswa until he reached Al-MashAAar Al-Haram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.'
duas.en_reference: Muslim 2/891.
duas.subtitle: Supplication for throwing a pebble at the Jamarât

duas.ar_dua: يُكَبِّرُ كُلَّمَا رَمَى بِحَصَاةٍ عِنْدَ الْجِمَارِ الثَّلاَثِ، ثُمَّ يَتَقَدَّمُ، ويَقِفُ يَدْعُو مُسْتَقْبِلَ الْقِبلَةِ، رَافِعاً يَدَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْجَمْرَةِ الْأُولَى وَالثَّانِيَةِ. أَمَّا جَمْرَةُ الْعَقَبَةِ فَيَرْمِيهَا وَيُكَبِّرُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ وَيَنْصَرِفُ وَلاَ يَقِفُ عِنْدَهَا
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) with each pebble he threw at the three pillars. Then he went forward, stood facing the Qiblah, and raised his hands and called upon Allah. That was after (stoning) the first and second pillars. As for the third, he stoned it and called out Allāhu Akbar with every pebble he threw, but when he was finished he left without standing at it (for supplications).
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/581, 3, 4, and Muslim
duas.subtitle: What to say at times of amazement and delight #1

duas.ar_dua: سُـبْحانَ الله
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāh!
duas.en_translation: (Glory is to Allah).
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/210, 390, 414 and Muslim 4/1857.
duas.subtitle: What to say at times of amazement and delight #2

duas.ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْـبَر
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar!
duas.en_translation: (Allah is the Most Great)
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/441. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 2/103, 235, Ahmad 5/218.
duas.subtitle: What to do upon receiving pleasant news

duas.ar_dua: كَانَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ أَمْرٌ يَسُرُّهُ أَوْ يُسَرُّ بِهِ خَرَّ سَاجِداً شُكْراً لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَتَعَالَى
duas.en_translation: The Prophet (ﷺ), upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure, would prostrate in gratitude to Allah blessed and exalted.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah1/233, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 2/226.
duas.subtitle: What to say and do when feeling some pain in the body

duas.ar_dua: ضَعْ يَدَكَ عَلَى الَّذِي تَألَّمَ مِنْ جَسَدِكَ وَقُلْ:  "بِسْمِ اللَّهِ"ثَلاَثاً،وَقُلْ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ:"أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ"
duas.transliteration: Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say:
duas.en_translation: Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say:  With the Name of Allah (three times). Then say seven times:  I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/1728.
duas.subtitle: What to say when in fear of afflicting something or someone with one's eye

duas.ar_dua: إِذَا رَأَى أَحَدُكُم مِنْ أَخِيهِ أَوْ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ أَوْ مِنْ مَالِهِ مَا يُعْجِبُهُ [فَلْيَدْعُ لَهُ بِالْبَرَكَةِ] فَإِنَّ الْعَيْنَ حَقٌّ
duas.en_translation: If you see something from your brother, yourself or wealth which you find impressing, then invoke blessings for it, for the evil eye is indeed true.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 4/447, Ibn Majah, Malik. Al-Albani graded it authentic inSahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/212. Also see Al-Arna'ut's checking of IbnAl-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad 4/170.
duas.subtitle: What to say when startled

duas.ar_dua: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh!
duas.en_translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah!
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/181, Muslim 4/2208.
duas.subtitle: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice

duas.ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ [اللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ وَلَكَ] اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنِّي
duas.transliteration: Bismillāh wallāhu Akbar[Allāhumma minka wa lak]Allāhumma taqabbal minnī.
duas.en_translation: With the Name of Allah,  Allah is the Most Great![O Allah, from You and to You.]O Allah, accept it from me.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 3/ 1557, Al-Bayhaqi 9/287.
duas.subtitle: What is said to ward off the deception of the Obstinate Shaytaans

duas.ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُهُنَّ بَرٌّ ولَا فَاجرٌمِنْ شّرِّ مَا خَلقَ،وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ،ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِوِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُجُ فيهَا،ومِن شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ في الأَرْضِومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا،وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ اللَّيْلِ والنَّهارِ،ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طارِقٍإِلَّا طَارِقاً يَطْرُقُ بخَيْرٍيَا رَحْمَنُ
duas.transliteration: A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti ‘llatī lā yujāwizuhunna barrun wa lā fājirun  min sharri mā khalaq,wa bara'a wa dhara',wa min sharri mā yanzilu minas-samā',wa min sharri mā ya`ruju fīhā,wa min sharri mā dhara'a fi ‘l-arḍ,wa min sharri ma yakhruju minhā,wa min sharri fitani ‘llayli wannahār,wa min sharri kulli ṭāriqinillā ṭāriqan yaṭruqu bikhayryā Rahmān.
duas.en_translation: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah -which neither the upright nor the corrupt may overcome -  from the evil of what He created,of what He made, and of what He scattered,  from the evil of what descends from theheavens,and of what rises up to them,from the evil of what He scattered in the earth,and of what emerges from it,from the evil trials of night and day,and from the evil of every night visitor,  except the night visitor who comes with good.O Merciful One.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no.637). Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of Al-'AqidahAt-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127.
duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #1

duas.ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم: "وَاللَّهِ إِنِّي لأَسْتَغفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْيَوْمِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةٍ"
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101.
duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #2

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَإِنِّي أَتُوبُ فِي الْيَوْمِ إِلَيْهِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ)
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2076.
duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #3

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الْعَظيمَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ القَيّوُمُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيهِ)، غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says: I seek the forgiveness of Allah the Mighty, Whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Living, the Eternal,and I repent to Him,Allah will forgive him even if he has deserted the army's ranks.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud 2/85, At-Tirmidhi 5/569, and Al-Hakim who declared it authenticand Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/511. Al-Albani graded it authentic inSahih At-Tirmidhi 3/182. See also Jami'ul-'Usool li-'Ahdaith Ar-Rasool 4/389-90 checked by Al-Arna'ut.
duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #4

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الرَّبُّ مِنَ الْعَبْدِ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ الآخِرِ فَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَنْ تَكُونَ مِمَّنْ يَذْكُرُ اللَّهَ فِي تِلْكَ السَّاعَةِ فَكُنْ
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmidhi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144.
duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #5

duas.ar_dua: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ رَبِّهِ وَهُوَ سَاجِدٌ فَأَكثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 1/350.
duas.subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #6

duas.ar_dua: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: إِنَّهُ لَيُغَانُ عَلَى قَلْبِي وَإِنِّي لأَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ فِي الْيَوْمِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (ﷺ) was alwaysvigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot todo any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind,he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek theforgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #1

duas.ar_dua: قَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) فِي يَوْمٍ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ حُطَّتْ خَطَايَاهُ وَلَوْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْر.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says: Glorified is Allah and praised is He. one hundred times a day, will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 91 of this book.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #2

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ) عَشْرَ مِرَارٍ، كَانَ كَمَنْ أَعْتَقَ أَرْبَعَةَ أَنْفُسٍ مِنْ وَلَدِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner.His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. ten times, will have the reward for freeing four slaves from the Children of Isma'il.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/67, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 93 of this book.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #3

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ، ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الْمِيزَانِ، حَبِيبَتَانِ إِلَى الرَّحْمَنِ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ)، (سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ)
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One: Glorified is Allah and praised is He, Glorified is Allah the Most Great.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2072.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #4

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: لَأَنْ أَقُولَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ)، أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ الشَّمسُ.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: For me to say: Glory is to Allah,and praise is to Allah,and there is none worthy of worship but Allah,  and Allah is the Most Great. is dearer to me than all that the sun rises upon (i.e. the whole world).
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2072.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #5

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَيَعْجِزُ أَحَدُكُم أَنْ يَكْسِبَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ فَسَأَلَهُ سَائِلٌ مِنْ جُلَسَائِهِ كَيْفَ يَكْسِبُ أَحَدُنَا أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ قَالَ: يُسَبِّحُ مِائَةَ تَسْبِيحَةٍ، فَيُكتَبُ لَهُ أَلْفُ حَسَنَةٍ أَوْ يُحَطُّ عَنْهُ أَلْفُ خَطِيئَةٍ.
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2073.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #6

duas.ar_dua: مَنْ قَالَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) غُرِسَتْ لَهُ نَخْلَةٌ فِي الْجَنَّةِ
duas.transliteration: Whoever says:
duas.en_translation: Whoever says: Glorified is Allah the Most Great and praised is He. will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/511, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabiagreed 1/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/531 and SahihAt-Tirmidhi3/160.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #7

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ قَيْسٍ أَلاَ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَى كَنْزٍ مِنْ كُنُوزِ الْجَنَّةِ؟ فَقُلْتُ: بَلَى يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ).
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise?"I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah."So he told me to say:  There is no power and no might except by Allah.
duas.en_reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/213, Muslim 4/2076.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #8

duas.ar_dua: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَحَبُّ الْكَلاَمِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَرْبَعٌ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ)، وَ(الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَ(لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)، وَ(اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ)، لاَ يَضُرُّكَ بِأَيِّهِنَّ بَدَأتَ
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.en_translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four: Glorified is Allah,and  The praise is for Allah,and  There is none worthy of worship but Allah,and  Allah is the Most Great.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 3/1685.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #9

duas.ar_dua: جَاءَ أَعْرَابِيٌّ إِلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ: عَلِّمْنِي كَلاماً أَقُولُهُ: قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العَالَمِينَ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ). قَالَ: فَهَؤُلاَءِ لِرَبِّي، فَمَا لِي؟ قَالَ: قُلْ (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي).
duas.transliteration: A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "Teach me a wordthat I can say. "The Prophet told him to say:
duas.en_translation: A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "Teach me a word that I can say. "The Prophet told him to say: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Who has no partner,Allah is the Great, the Most Great,and praise is to Allah in abundance,glory is to Allah, Lord of the worlds.There is no power and no might but by Allah the Mighty, the Wise. He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?"The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to say: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me, and provide for me.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2072, Abu Dawud reports the same Hadith with the addition: andwhen the Arab left, the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "He has filled his hands withgoodness."1/220.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #10

duas.ar_dua: كَانَ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا أَسْلَمَ عَلَّمَهُ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم الصَّلاَةَ ثُمَّ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَدْعُوَ بِهَؤُلاَءِ الْكَلِمَاتِ: (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرِ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَعَافِنِي وَارْزُقْنِي)
duas.transliteration: Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how topray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words:
duas.en_translation: Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how to pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me and give me good health and provide for me.
duas.en_reference: Muslim 4/2073, and in one of Muslim's reports there is the addition: 'Forthese words combine [the goodness of] this world and the next.'
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #11

duas.ar_dua: إِنَّ أَفْضَلَ الدُّعَاءِ (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَأَفْضَلَ الذِّكْرِ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)
duas.transliteration: The most excellent invocation is:
duas.en_translation: The most excellent invocation is: Praise is for Allah. and the most excellent words of remembrance are: There is none worthy of worship but Allah.
duas.en_reference: At-Tirmidhi 5/462, Ibn Majah 2/1249, and Al-Hakim who graded it authenticand Ath-Tbahabi agreed 1/503. See Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/362.
duas.subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #12

duas.ar_dua: الباقيات الصالحات : (سبحان الله) و(الحمد لله )، و(لا إله إلا الله)، و(الله أكبر) ،و (لا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله).
duas.en_translation: The good deeds which endure are: Glorified is Allah,and  The praise is for Allah,and  There is none worthy of worship but Allah,  and  Allah is the Most Great,  and  There is no power and no might except by Allah.
duas.en_reference: Ahmad (no. 513) (Ahmad Shakir, ed.) and its chain of narration isauthentic. See Majma'uz-Zawa'id 1/297. Ibn Hajar mentions it inBulughul-Maram saying that Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim considered it authentic.
duas.subtitle: How the Prophet ﷺ made tasbîĥ?

duas.ar_dua: عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو رضي الله عنهما قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَعْقِدُ التَّسْبِيحَ بِيَمِينِهِ.
duas.en_translation: Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA) said:  I saw the Prophet ﷺ counting the glorification of his Lord on his right hand.
duas.en_reference: Abu Dawud with a different wording 2/81, and At-Tirmidhi 5/521. See alsoAl-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 4/271 (no. 4865).
duas.subtitle: How the Prophet ﷺ made tasbîĥ?
